title: Intermediate Hydrogeologist
description:
Wood has an exciting career opportunity in our Physical Hydrogeology Group for a Intermediate Hydrogeologist. This position is based in the Greater Toronto Area and will support our infrastructure, municipal and mining work. The position will report to one of the group’s Senior Hydrogeologists and will be based in our Burlington office.





The successful candidate will be working with a highly motivated team of professionals delivering quality services on technically challenging projects. You would become involved with primarily physical hydrogeological investigations to support multi-disciplinary projects in a variety of fields, including construction dewatering assessments and permitting, water supply, transportation, mining, oil and gas, and energy projects, among others across Ontario.





Key Responsibilities:



+ Responsible for collection of hydrogeological data under direction from Senior Staff, including: logging of soil borings and rock cores, oversight of groundwater monitoring well installations, collection of surface water and groundwater samples and levels, collect surface water flows, aquifer testing (slug tests and pumping tests) and drilling or test pitting supervision


+ Collect and evaluate field measurements and record data in clear and concise field notes


+ Office activities may include data tabulation and presentation of field sampling results, including report tables and appendices, support for work plan preparation, interpretation of analytical results, preparation of investigation reports and other project documents under the supervision of Senior Staff


+ Follow company safety standards, participate in safety training, prepare and implement site safety plans


+ Interact with client, contractor or subcontractor representatives on project sites


+ Work collaboratively with members of the Hydrogeology Group and team members from other internal business lines and offices, as well as external sub-contractors/consultants, and clients


+ Work with other disciplines within Wood including but not limited to environmental, geotechnical and water resources


+ Opportunities to collaborate with Wood teams across Ontario and sometimes across Canada and internationally





+ Undergraduate Degree (B.Sc.) in Geoscience or Civil/Environmental Engineering with a focus on Hydrogeology


+ Registered or eligible for registration as a GIT or EIT in Ontario considered as assst.




+ Consulting experience in hydrogeology or related discipline considered an asset.


+ Team-oriented, self-motivated and safety conscious


+ Ability to work independently in both field and office environments with strong attention to detail and organizational and problem-solving skills


+ Strong technical, verbal, and written communication skills (English) are required


+ Competency with MS Office suite of applications


+ Some technical report and/or document writing experience an asset


+ Some experience with ArcGIS considered an asset


+ Must be willing to travel (mostly within Southern Ontario, but with occasional remote northern or out of province projects)


+ Valid Class G Ontario Driver’s License and vehicle appropriate for carrying field equipment




Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com



We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

Name: Staff / Permanent

External Company Name: Wood Plc

External Company URL: http://www.woodplc.com/

title: Geotechnician (Fixed Term - Seasonal)
description:
Mission for this Position:

About Us

 

At Baffinland, we work and live beyond the Arctic Circle, mining iron ore at our Mary River Property, located in the Qikiqtani Region of Nunavut on Baffin Island; one of the worldâ€™s most captivating and seldom seen destinations. We are a unique company with a strong management who have amassed specialty experience on northern mining projects through all phases of Inuit consultation, permitting, construction and operation. Our workforce brings together the modern practice of safe, sustainable mining and the enduring value of a traditional culture, which is rapidly advancing. The result is a work and community experience you won't find anywhere else. We are looking for people ready to share, build, and grow with our company.

 

Reporting to the Ferrous Project Geologists, provide geotechnical support for drilling and field programs, including down hole surveys, drill core processing, geotechnical logging, daily monitoring of drilling activities and drill site inspections, and other camp duties as required. This includes assisting geological staff as required and communicating safe work procedures to all contractors on site.

 

The position is site based with 3 weeks on / 3 weeks off rotation and will be on a fixed term contract from May 2022 - October 2022.

Main Accountabilities:
  • Follow and adhere to Baffinlandâ€™s Environmental, Health and Safety Policies and Standards at all times
  • Geotechnical core logging.
  • Mentoring Field Assistants
  • Monitor and record salinity, water usage, and general site conditions at drill locations.
  • Daily inspection of drill site for environmental / safety issues and hazards.
  • Monitoring drill progress and utilization.
  • Assisting with core storage and retrieval
  • Preparation of core samples for shipment to off-site laboratories.
  • Daily communication with Geologists and contractors.
  • General camp duties as required in support of Exploration programs
Main Qualifications:
  • Ability to lift and carry ~30 kg of boxed core.
  • College Diploma - Mineral Exploration Techniques or similar
  • Technician or Technologist designation in Earth Science or Geology
  • Geotechnical Engineering, Geology or Earth Science, 3rd year student or recent graduate
  • Experience with collection and analysis of spatial data such as geological, civil, mining, or enviornmental
  • Experience working with indigenous people and communities would be an asset
  • Experience working in remote mining camps
  • Hold a valid Standard First Aid / CPR certificate or be willing to obtain
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
  • Hold or be able to obtain a site driver's license

title: Junior Geoscientist / Engineer
description:
:

What You Will Do

 

Gannett Fleming is looking for a Junior Geoscientist/Engineer-in-Training to coordinate and conduct environmental site assessments (Phase 1/2 ESAs), environmental due diligence studies, and contaminated site investigations/remediations for transit, transportation, and other projects.   Come join our growing Environmental Team in  Toronto, Ontario!

 

Duties and Key Responsibilities:

  • Plan, coordinate, and help execute environmental due diligence/contaminated site assessment programs for transit and transportation projects, including Phase 1/2 Environmental Site Assessments (ESAs).
  • Conduct Phase 1 and Phase 2 ESAs in accordance with Canadian Standards Association (CSA) standards and Ontario Regulation 153/04.
  • Coordinate, design and execute field work programs to support environmental contamination studies/Phase 1/2 ESAs.
  • Manage reporting aspects for due diligence environmental contamination studies (soil, groundwater etc.) and Phase 1/2 ESAs.
  • Coordinate and carry out field work such as supervising geo-environmental drillers, soil sampling, logging soil core, supervising the installation of monitoring wells, development of monitoring wells, hydraulic conductivity testing, and groundwater sampling.
  • Perform project coordination duties to deliver exceptional products on time and within budget.
  • Work collaboratively with other team members.
  • Apply the best available science and engineering practices.
:

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree (or higher) in a relevant discipline such as environmental science, environmental engineering, hydrogeology or geology.
  • 2-4 years of experience in the field of environmental science or engineering in Ontario.
  • Proficiency and experience in applying and ensuring compliance with relevant procedures and environmental regulatory requirements associated with Ontario Regulation 153/04.
  • Working knowledge and expertise with applicable CSA principles, practices and requirements including CAN/CSA-Z768-01 (R2016), CAN/CSA-Z769-00 (R2018), etc.
  • Demonstrated experience in carrying out Phase 1 and Phase 2 Environmental Site Assessments, including designing and executing field work programs to support environmental site investigations.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to problem solve.
  • Meet qualifications to be a Qualified Person (i.e., GIT/P.Geo. or EIT/P.Eng. in relevant field in Ontario) under O. Reg. 153/04, based on education, training and professional experience.
  • Successful candidate must be self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to collaborate within a team environment.
  • Strong data evaluation, reporting capabilities as well as strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Willing to travel to project sites, as required, to complete necessary field investigations and data collection.
  • Valid driverâ€™s license in Ontario with access to a reliable vehicle.

#LI-Hybrid

:

At  Gannett Fleming, we believe in  improving  the lives of the people we serve. We believe in  innovation  and social responsibility. We believe in the  diversity  of our team and the creative solutions they provide. We believe in embracing  change  and emerging technologies while maintaining an unmatched standard of quality. We believe in creating an environment where employees can thrive at home and at work. We believe in engaging our employees, building lasting relationships with our clients, and, in turn, making a difference in the world.

 

We offer a comprehensive benefits program, which includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance, our tax-deferred retirement plan, and  the opportunity to incentive compensation for eligible positions. We are committed to your personal growth and professional development, so we offer tuition reimbursement, access to internal and external training programs and support active participation in professional organizations.

 

Gannett Fleming is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteransâ€™ status or other characteristics protected by law.  

 

Permanent Residency or Canadian Citizenship required for this position. No relocation assistance will be provided for this position. Local candidates will be given preference.

 

NO AGENCIES PLEASE: Unsolicited resumes from third party agencies will not be accepted.

 

Location: Toronto, Ontario

Core Business Hours: 8:00 AM â€“ 5:00 PM
Employment Status: Full-Time  

Salary Range: Salary dependent upon experience and geographic location

#L1: Hybrid

 

Please be advised that Gannett Fleming may require you to provide proof of the Covid-19 vaccination to meet regulatory and client requirements. Upon hire, you will be required to attest to your vaccination status. Valid religious and medical exemptions will be reviewed and considered in accordance with applicable law.

title: Project Manager - Hydrology / Hydraulics River
description:
It's true ! at Tetra Tech, life is part of our plans ... and in reality, it's more than that! We take care of the human being and we are aware that our people are our strength! Our reputation is based on the technical expertise and commitment of more than 20,000 professionals around the world, including more than 3,500 in Canada and 1,500 in Quebec.

What makes Tetra Tech the company where you want to work

  • the teams are overflowing with friendly people;
  • Our troops quickly adapted to the new reality of teleworking;
  • There are experienced experts who collaborate on a daily basis in a pleasant environment;
  • technical development and progression are part of the internal culture;
  • Sustainable development is one of our priorities and we integrate it on a daily basis to improve the situation of our customers and that of the planet.

What we are missing to shine the "Water Resources" team, it is a Project Manager in fluvial hydraulics that stands out for its technical expertise, management skills and Project planning and passion for water management. Regardless of your location in Quebec, come and participate in large projects in telecommuting mode.

Place of work: Office of Montreal, Boucherville, Granby, Quebec, Three- Rivers, Stockings St. Lawrence

Flexible work mode (desktop, teleworking, hybrid)

The challenges that will allow you to surpass you

  • act as project manager for different hydraulic projects of watercourses, maritime hydraulics and dam safety;
  • Coordinate and supervise a work team;
  • Perform hydraulic and hydraulic studies related to the design of different books (bridge, culvert, dam, energy sink, agricultural drainage, etc.);
  • perform hydraulic studies in safety of dams;
  • Participate in the writing of service offers;
  • produce various reports and technical quotations;
  • Ensure the administrative management of the projects and to assume the res Assignability (contract management);
  • work in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team and provide technical supervision;
  • participate and coordinate meetings with customers to advise them in their approach;
  • Provide constant communication with clients for tracking activities and deliverables.

What makes you the ideal person for this post

Chez Tetra Tech, we have a place for you! With the wide variety of projects we have, your role will be adapted according to your expertise.

  • Bachelor's degree in civil engineering or water genius;
  • Minimum of 7 years of project design and management experience;
  • strong management skills, negotiations, communication and problem solving;
  • be open to collaboration and have a good sense of communication;
  • bilingual (an asset);
  • Experience Engineering consulting (an asset);
  • Member in good standing of the 'OIQ.

Tetra Tech subscribes to an Employment Equality Access Program and invites women, aboriginals, people with disabilities as well as members of minorities visible or ethnic to apply. Please note that only selected applications will be contacted.

title: Principal Groundwater Modeller - Australia
description:
• Relocate with WSP Australia
  • Competitive salary packages on offer
  • Visa and relocation support offered
  • Join our growing Mining Services Team

About us

With approximately 54,000 talented people globally and 6,100 across more than 50 offices in Australia and New Zealand, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for lifetimes to come. We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international brainpower.

We have recently joined forces with Golder, making WSP the largest environmental consulting firm globally, with over 14,000 environment professionals. Together, we can accelerate our global Environmental, Social & Governance vision, and make an impact on our built and natural environment.

The Opportunity

WSP and Golder coming together has strengthened our Ecology capability and is enabling like-minded professionals to collaborate more easily; better leveraging technology and accessing a broader client base.

Join our Mining Services team as a Groundwater Modeller where you will engage your aptitude to lead the Mine Services Business, as well as the management of major projects. Act as technical advisor to both internal & external stakeholders while supporting business development.

What you will do

  • Provide technical input to a diverse range of Ground Water projects, ensuring the work complies with quality systems and client requirements.
  • Develop project management plans. Review project scope, time and cost requirements.
  • Design, deliver and/or project management of multiple projects of varying complexity and size.
  • Develop and review project quality and risk management plans.
  • Understand key contractual and commercial issues.
  • Coach/Mentor the team and contribute to business development.
  • Prepare and cost quality proposals.
  • Recognize the achievements and success of individuals and the team. 

What we will love about you

  • Bachelor’s Degree (Environmental/Science/Geology/Hydrogeology or equivalent tertiary qualifications
  • Typically, 20+ years' experience.
  • Expert in field with broad experience in providing key technical expertise across a wide range of diverse and complete geospatial projects.
  • Experience in working with industry leads and client relationship mangers to drive market and client strategies
  • That maximise Section and Business Group revenue and provide excellent client services.
  • Highly competent in managing risk on substantial projects.
  • Constantly demonstrated multiple instances of delivering best client outcomes/options which have saved the client cost/time and prevented community problems.
  • Recognised as industry expert in technical discipline with Industry Boards/Agency.
  • Highly competent in managing the scope of complex multiple large scale projects.
  • Proven ability to prepare and review complex technical project reports, pursuits and proposals.
  • Extensive experience in developing strong client relationships.

Some of the many benefits we offer our employees include:

  • Flexible working hours and working from home
  • Global mobility
  • Parental leave & purchased additional annual leave
  • Corporate employee discounts and offers
  • Salary continuance insurance
  • Wellness at work & social club
  • Workplace giving /volunteering
  • Employee reward & recognition program
  • Professional and technical development opportunities

Inspired by Diversity, Driven by Inclusion…….

Discover a forward-thinking culture that incorporates some conventional yet non-negotiable qualities—like respect, integrity and trust. We welcome to the table all perspectives, strengths, skills, creeds and genders because we know that diverse ideas breed extraordinary results.

WSP supports a diverse and inclusive work environment as well as equal employment opportunities. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people of culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.

If you want to have a confidential conversation about the role feel free to get in touch with Jeremy Olaivar at

http://Jeremy.Olaivar@wsp.com/

Please note we will not be engaging the services of recruitment agencies for this role.

title: Senior Hydrogeologist/Engineer/Scientist
description:
Senior Hydrogeologist/Engineer/Scientist
Guelph, Ontario
Are you looking for a change?  Do you enjoy variety, learning, and working with a team of highly skilled experts?
Our Client is seeking an energetic individual to join their Geoscience team in Guelph, as a Senior Hydrogeologist/Engineer/Scientist. Work will focus on projects in Southern Ontario focusing on the GTA and Niagara Region area.

Duties:
  • Design and implementation of environmental site assessments and remediation systems.
  • Development of conceptual site models.
  • Plan and conduct hydrogeological assessments.
  • Analysis and interpretation of environmental data, preparation of technical reports, and detailed technical review.
  • Consulting with, as well as answering technical questions from colleagues, clients, and regulatory agencies.
  • On-going development of client relationships, as well as expanding site assessment and remediation service offerings.
  • Mentoring junior and intermediate staff.
  • Travel is required.
Qualifications:
  • 10 + years consulting experience focusing primarily on Environmental Site Assessments, Remedial Action Plans, Records of Site Condition, etc.
  • Post-secondary education in engineering or hydrogeology with a proven specialty in contaminant hydrogeology, environmental site assessments and remediation.
  • Licensed under the Professional Engineers – Ontario (P.Eng.) or Association of Professional Geoscientists of Ontario, (P.Geo.).
  • A Qualified Person for Environmental Site Assessment and/or Remediation per O. Reg. 153/04 requirements.
  • Experience implementing soil vapour intrusion studies, as well as mitigation systems is considered an asset.
     
    Candidates should also possess:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Aptitude for attention to detail to ensure a high degree of quality assurance and quality control
  • Strong people and team skills as well as being highly motivated
  • Proven problem-solving ability and resourcefulness
  • An ability to work in a fast-paced team environment with little to no supervision
  • Exceptional organizational capabilities, coordination and consultation skills
  • Ability to work on a number of projects at once and proven ability to successfully meet deadlines
  • A valid driver’s licence
 Salary: Commensurate with experience 
 
Thank you in advance for your application.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Environment Engineer/Hydrogeologist
description:
Job Description

Environment Engineer/Hydrogeologist

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction, and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

SNC-Lavalin is seeking an Intermediate Geoscientist/Engineer to join our team serving our private industry and government clients throughout Ontario. The successful candidate will be part of a team of environmental engineers/geoscientists and, depending on project complexity, will lead or provide support for projects related to environmental investigation and remediation, hydrogeological investigations and/or construction monitoring supporting private industry and government support sectors.

The successful candidate will bring demonstrated project management and technical skills and will be able to provide effective communication and direction when dealing with project team members, subcontractors/suppliers, and clients. Liaising with regulatory agencies, networking with professionals, and developing new business would be secondary aspects of this role.

The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in field execution and management of Phase I/II/III environmental site assessment and remediation projects.  Experience in the management of sediment assessments, risk assessments, landfill monitoring and development and operation and designated substance surveys would be considered an asset.

How will you contribute to the team?

Specific duties related to this position vary depending on level of experience, but are generally as follows:

  • Understanding client objectives, technical protocols, laws, guidelines, and regulations that apply to the work/projects conducted and the rationale/developmental framework behind them.
  • Project management (including technical program development, management of personnel and resources, tracking costs and managing budgets, implementing quality assurance reviews, and ensuring client objectives are met).
  • Conducting field investigations.
  • Embracing behavior-based safety and ensuring all health and safety protocols are followed. 

Responsibilities:

  • Management or coordination of projects of varying complexity involving soil, groundwater, surface water, sediment and/or soil vapour and remedial system design and implementation, environmental compliance and designated substances and hazardous materials.
  • Executing technical tasks requiring accuracy in calculations, completeness, and adherence to prescribed data testing methods, which may include field work.
  • Preparing reports, proposals, and other project documents of varying complexity
  • Promote team effort and collaboration.
  • Developing budgets, tracking costs and schedules, and maintaining profitability.

What will you contribute?

  • Licensure, or eligible to be licenced, as a professional engineer or geoscientist in Ontario.
  • 5+ years of progressive practical environmental engineering/consulting experience, including experience conducing field investigations in accordance with standard operating procedures, including, sampling of soil, groundwater, surface water, sediment and soil vapour or collection of representative building materials/components for analysis.
  • Superior organization and management skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Knowledge of environmental laws, regulations, and guidelines as they apply to environmental projects in Ontario.
  • A commitment to teamwork and established multi-disciplinary communication skills.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (i.e.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology, and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Intermediate Hydrology Specialist
description:
Location

Calgary, AB

Description

Hatfield has been awardedBC’s Top Employers for 2022and we’re looking for more outstanding people to join our team! We do interesting and meaningful work with opportunities for career and professional growth. We also offer a competitive compensation package, flexible work hours, vacation allowances, and comprehensive health benefits including extended health coverage, an employee and family assistance program, and a RRSP matching plan.

Hatfield Consultants is seeking a highly motivated Intermediate Hydrology Specialist to become part of our growing Water Resources team and provide field, technical, and project coordination support for the implementation of hydrology, climate and hydrogeology monitoring components of Hatfield’s energy, oil and gas, mining, and infrastructure projects in Alberta. The position is full-time permanent and would be a combination of office and fieldwork, based out of our Calgary office with frequent travel to Fort McMurray and other remote locations in western Canada. Start date is negotiable.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and coordinate remote field programs, assist with resource scheduling and project management.
  • Prepare for, lead and/or participate in field programs required for hydrologic data collection and monitoring programs. When in the field, support the mentoring of junior staff with regard to data collection and monitoring activities.
  • Ensure equipment is maintained and calibrated to meet operational and field requirements.
  • Interact with a multidisciplinary team to assess potential project-related and/or climate change-related impacts on water resources and environmental values. This may include supporting the coordination and/or implementation of other water resource (e.g., groundwater, water quality, climate, aquatic, fish, construction) monitoring programs.
  • Compile, manage and assess hydrologic, water use, water quality, and other environmental data.
  • Support ongoing data management (e.g., review of near-real-time telemetry data) and reporting (e.g., Draft technical reports and data summaries).

Education and Experience:

Mandatory requirements for this position include:

  • B.Sc. or technical diploma in natural/environmental sciences or engineering with some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in hydrology or physical geography.
  • Appropriate qualifications for work in Alberta and British Columbia, and a valid Canadian driver’s license.
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written – including technical, scientific writing) skills.
  • Experience and interest in field work. This position will be based in Calgary, but will have frequent travel to remote locations, for various durations, based out of hotels and camps.
  • Knowledge of standard operating procedures, industry standards and best practices for hydrometric data collection.
  • Experience and interest in data compilation and analysis.

Prior experience with the following is considered an asset for this position:

  • Field investigation and monitoring programs, focussed on hydrological programs.
  • Familiarity and comfort with remote site work including oil sands properties in Alberta.
  • Project coordination, field project management, project management.
  • Some prior formal training (e.g., coursework) in related environmental fields, such as geology/hydrogelogy, climate science, biology or chemistry.
  • Other field experience, such as construction monitoring, groundwater monitoring, climate station monitoring and environmental effects monitoring etc.

Hatfield is committed to employment equity and workplace diversity. We strive for equity, inclusiveness and diversity, irrespective of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression or disability.

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV describing your experience and salary expectations in confidence through the online form or email:

resumes@hatfieldgroup.catsone.com

(no phone calls please). Please indicate “CGY Hydrology” in your subject line. Due to the volume of applicants, only short-listed candidates will be notified but we will retain your resume for any future openings.

title: Intermediate Hydrogeologist
description:
Overview:

Overview

Are you someone with strong leadership and technical capabilities?   Do you enjoy building relationships and working collaboratively in a team environment with both internal and external stakeholders? Are you a thought leader, a trusted colleague and a problem solver? As someone with excellent  communication skills and business acumen, you will thrive in our fast-paced and agile environment.

 

Your opportunity

Dillonâ€™s  Environmental Sciences technical group is looking for an Intermediate Hydrogeologist or Environmental Engineer to join our multidisciplinary team of professionals. You will have the opportunity to work on new and exciting projects while providing clients with a fully integrated and superior customer experience.  

 

At Dillon, we operate as one team. This position is available at any of the following Dillon offices across Ontario.

Responsibilities:

What your day will look like

Project Management & Design (87%)

  1. Environmental (Hydrogeology) Lead for a large scale projects with responsibilities that include:
      1. Lead Hydrogeology team and liaise with other disciplines
      2. Lead the preparation of deliverables related to hydrogeology /contamination
      3. Support in-market process
      4. Review specifications, submittals and contract documents
      5. Review contractor submissions, respond to requests for information
      6. Conduct technical reviews and coordinate with other technical support staff as needed
      7. Coordinate with Engineers and design compliance manager and other design reviewers to resolve conflicting comments
  2. Manage and lead the preparation of technical reports that may include: hydrogeological assessments, studies to support Permits to Take Water/ Environmental Activity and Sector Registry submissions Phase I/II/III ESAs, conceptual site models, remedial options analysis, remedial action plans, tender packages (including technical specifications and contract drawings), and cost estimates
  3. Lead and oversee the design and implementation of sampling programs for the collection of soil, groundwater, surface water and sediments
  4. Comply with corporate, client, and site-specific health and safety protocols and programs and applicable health and safety regulations
  5. Work with senior specialists and technical teams on development of remedial and/or risk management options

 Business Development (10%)

  1. Respond to Requests for Proposal related to contaminated sites work and develop strong client relationships
  2. Coordinate, manage and build business relationships with: clients, regulators, service providers (e.g., laboratories, sub-contractor) and third-party stakeholders  

Learning & Development (3%)

  1. A commitment to self-development and ongoing learning and professional development
  2. Input to the career development of junior staff, including technical direction, training recommendations, coaching and mentoring
  3. Contribute to Dillonâ€™s corporate profile through active participation in professional associations and committees
Qualifications:

What you will need to succeed

  1. Ten or more years of experience in hydrogeology or environmental engineering consulting
  2. Strong background in physical and chemical hydrogeology, contaminated sites management, remediation, construction projects and health and safety
  3. A degree in earth science/hydrogeology, environmental engineering, geology, or another relevant engineering discipline.
  4. Licensed to practice as a Professional Geoscientist or Engineer in the Province of Ontario (or eligible for transfer of registration from another Canadian jurisdiction)
  5. Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication, and organizational skills.
  6. Exceptional problem solving and critical thinking skills
  7. Passionate about personal and professional growth, working collaboratively to meet and exceed our clientsâ€™ expectations, and developing innovative solutions
  8. Has or is fully able to obtain Federal Security Status
  9. Valid Driverâ€™s License
Experience:
  1. Proven experience managing multi-disciplinary projects and providing consulting services in the field of hydrogeology, particularly linear infrastructure/transit projects
  2. Demonstrated understanding of environmental regulations related to contaminated sites, hydrogeology, and excess soil management in Ontario (e.g. O. Reg. 153, O. Reg. 903, O. Reg. 406, R.R.O. Reg. 347, etc.)  
  3. Experience with contract administration and construction observation
  4. Technical proficiency in several or many of the following will be considered an asset: groundwater modelling, excess soils management, Ontario Regulation 406/19, landfill hydrogeology.

Why choose Dillon?

Dillon is powered by people who are technically proficient, passionate about socially important projects, and motivated to deliver superior, tangible results. We strive to remain at the forefront of technology and innovation, and are empowered to continually grow and develop.  

 

We live our  core values:

  • Reliability: words result in actions that build trust;
  • Achievement: do the work to hit the target;
  • Continuous development: always learning; always adapting; always growing;
  • Creativity: discover new possibilities;
  • Courage: do the things that matter, especially when itâ€™s hard;
  • Inclusiveness: enabling belonging to draw strength from our differences.

 In addition, we offer:

  • Employee share purchase plan
    • Dillon is 100% employee owned and share ownership is open to all employees.
  • A competitive compensation package
    • Comprehensive health benefits
    • Generous retirement savings plan
    • Student loan repayment assistance with matching employer contributions
  • Flexible work hours and remote working options
    • Dillon values its staff and the contributions that are made each day and understands that work arrangements can differ based on personal needs and business needs.   We are taking a trust-based approach to oï¬€er a variety of ï¬‚exible and remote work options to help balance the competing demands of work and personal life.
  • Learning and Development opportunities
    • As a knowledge-based business, the organic growth of our knowledge and skills occur through our work performance and roles. The creation and sharing of knowledge allows us to take local knowledge to scale, capture lessons learned through experience, and continuously improve service delivery. The development of self and others is an evident and measured core behaviour within our organization.
    • We use a composite approach to development including coaching to build the how, mentoring to share lessons, advising  to round out perspectives, and co-creation of knowledge through internal, and learning opportunities.
  • Focus on Innovation
    • The ability to anticipate, examine, and adopt new and innovative solutions is a crucial driver for the continual and progressive advancement of our business performance. In our culture, people are empowered to reflect and question current practices and seek forward looking solutions to todayâ€™s problems and tomorrowâ€™s opportunities.
  • Employee and Family Assistance program
    • A variety of EFAP tools and online resources to support well-being are available to all employees.
  • Goodlife Fitness Corporate Membership
    • Our employees can take advantage of reduced annual membership fees

 About Dillon

Dillon is a proudly Canadian, employee-owned, professional consulting firm specializing in planning, engineering, environmental science and management. We partner with clients to provide committed, collaborative, and inventive solutions to complex, multi-faceted projects. With over 20 offices and more than 900 employees across Canada, Dillon offers a wide range of services related to building and improving facilities and infrastructure, protecting the environment, and developing communities.

 

Now operating for over 75 years, we continue to strive for excellence in everything we do. Dillon has been listed as one of  Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies for the past 15 years and has the distinction of having achieved Platinum Club member status in this program.

 

Employment Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Dillon:

Dillon is committed to the principles of employment equity, inclusiveness, and diversity within our organization.  We strive  to achieve a workplace where opportunities are based on skills and abilities and that respects and values differences.  

 

Inclusion is more than a word to us, it is the way we choose to run our business.  

We encourage you to connect with us at  

accommodation@dillon.ca

 if you require  accommodation in the interview process.  

We would love to hear from you!

title: Geophysical Data Processor
description:
Company Description

Xcalibur Airborne Geophysics offers a diverse range of services such as fixed- and rotary-wing airborne gradient magnetic and radiometric, EM & gravity surveys. Our service offering includes value-adding data processing and interpretation conducted by a team of dedicated, highly skilled and experienced staff.

We cost efficiently probe the sub-surface beneath sand or sediment cover and inaccessible forest or swamp, to add valuable information to projects. This ranges from detailed infra-structure and geotechnical studies, geohydrology, mineral, oil & gas exploration projects, to large mapping surveys for grass-roots exploration and investor information.

Safety, efficient operations and exceptional data quality are the foundation on which the company operates and underpin the key values of the company.

To build on the success of our business we are continuing to strengthen, mobilize, and energize our most important asset: OUR PEOPLE

We actively encourage technical excellence, problem-solving, innovation and teamwork.

Job Description

Job Profile:

The Geophysical Data Processor is responsible for data quality control and reporting during data acquisition, processing data to final and produce high quality products based on project specifications and scheduled timeframes while in accordance with Xcalibur processing procedures and standards.  The position will require the individual to work flexible hours as the workload dictates as well as field assignments depending upon project requirements. The role will also have responsibility to support the department manager in other duties as required.

Technical:

  • Verify the equipment operational health during project start-up
  • Perform quality control checks on acquisition data and ensure the data meets the project specifications
  •  Ensure that processing procedures are followed, and documentation completed accordingly
  • Deliver products and reports that meet the internal quality standards along the allotted schedules
  • Maintain regular backups and progress reporting
  • Provide comments/recommendations regarding processing procedures and data quality standards
  • Software testing
  • Provide support for other team members

Communication:

  • Communicate effectively with clients, project management team and field personnel.
  • Liaise with clients to keep them informed of the status of their project deliverables
  • Client deliverable presentations
  • Report on any possible equipment issues after reviewing acquired geophysical data.

 

Qualifications

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Geophysics, or any related Earth Sciences
  • Professional designation as a geoscientist or engineer preferred
  • Two years of processing experience in the geophysical industry preferred

Competencies for the Role

  • Teamwork - Building Trust, Influencing, 
  • Cooperation- Interpersonal and Intercultural awareness
  • Performance Orientation-Resilience, Results Focus
  • Strong communication skills - verbal and written for both internal and client interactions
  • Strong organizational practices.
  • Self-motivated, ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to problem solve and propose solutions/corrections.


Additional Information

Benefits and Perks        

  • Competitive salary
  • Highly attractive bonus scheme
  • Employee/Family Assistance program
  • Medical & Dental Coverage
  • Health and Wellness benefits
  • RRSP match
  • Short term/Long term disability

title: Laboratory Technician, Mineral Processing
description:
Company Description

We are SGS – the world’s leading Testing, Inspection and Certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 96,000 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a Better, Safer and more Interconnected world

Job Description

This position will conduct a wide variety of testing and analysis on base and precious metal ores, industrial minerals and materials.

This job description applies to Laboratory Technicians in the Canadian metallurgical operations, in the technical areas of Mineral Processing, Gold Processing, Hydrometallurgy, Geometallurgy, Environmental Testing, and Mineralogy.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES

•    Receive, inspect, sort and label client samples.
•    Sort, crush, pulverize, split, and screen samples.
•    Conduct routine testing.
•    Record test data and communicate results.   
•    Carry out routine equipment maintenance.
•    Calibrate and setup equipment prior to analysis.
•    Install and operate equipment and systems.
•    Maintain a clean working environment.
•    Follow all company Health, Safety and Environmental policies.
•    Follow all Quality system protocols and report any discrepancies to the Supervisor.
•    May be assigned special or ad hoc projects.
 

 

Qualifications

PROFILE

•    A minimum of a high school diploma (or equivalent) is required.
•    Good hand/eye coordination when handling samples & various equipment.

REQUIRED SKILLS

•    Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner. 
•    Incumbents must be proficient in using various types of computer software (Word, Excel. PowerPoint & Outlook).
•    Good time management skills and a strong attention to detail.
•    Candidates must be able to communicate effectively in English, in both verbal and written communication.
•    Ability to work well with others & independently. 
•    Ability to work well under pressure.
•    Extended hours and shift work may be required from time to time.
•    Travel to other SGS locations or client location may be required from time to time.
•    Must ensure full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies.
 



Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process.  Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Hydrogeologist
description:
Description:
Are you a Junior or Intermediate level professional who is passionate in Environmental Engineering, Geology/Hydrogeology, or Water Resources Engineering? I am open to connect with you!
Agilus is recruiting for a Hydrogeologist in the Land Development industry in Kitchener, Ontario.
A Hydrogeologist with P. Eng. designation, or P. Geo. designation who has a good understanding of applicable regulatory requirements (Ontario Water Resources Act, Environmental Protection Act and other applicable federal and provincial acts, regulations, and guidelines) and general engineering / hydrogeological practices and processes.
Responsibilities:
  • Conduct hydrogeological assessments, dewatering assessments, surface water assessments, water supply studies, water taking permits
  • Data analysis, interpretation, and reporting (i.e. Hydrogeological Investigations and Groundwater Monitoring Reports)
  • Technical reviews of reports to ensure compliance with client objectives, regulatory requirements and technical standards (QA/QC assessment of data and reports)
  • Responsible for supervising and coordinating field activities associated with hydrogeological assessments, surface water assessments, water supply studies, Permits To Take Water

Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental or Civil Engineering, Geology/Hydrogeology, Earth Sciences or Water Resources Engineering (or equivalent)
  • Member in good standing with Professional Engineers Ontario, with P. Eng. designation, or the Association of Professional Geoscientists of Ontario, with P. Geo. designation
  • Understanding of applicable regulatory requirements (Ontario Water Resources Act, Environmental Protection Act and other applicable federal and provincial acts, regulations, and guidelines) and general engineering / hydrogeological practices and processes
  • Knowledge of construction dewatering, groundwater and surface water interactions, and soil and bedrock classification
  • Experience with GIS, AutoCAD and Aquifer Test an asset
  • Regular travel to project sites is required. Mileage for work related travel will be reimbursed

What's in it for you:
  • Competitive Wages
  • Shared Ownership in Our Employee Owned Company
  • Group RRSP Matching program
  • Technical Development and Career Opportunities
  • Social and Supportive Culture; and much more!

We want to connect with you!
Please apply directly online by email clegaspi@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Geology Summer Student
description:
St Barbara Atlantic are seeking Geology Summer Students for our Touquoy Mine based exploration team. The Touquoy site is located approximately one hour outside of Halifax, Nova Scotia Canada and went into production in fall 2017. Work continues to identify and define additional deposits in the province.

 

Reporting to the Regional Exploration Superintendent or the MRC Exploration Superintendent, Geology Summer Students will participate in expanding exploration activities and work collaboratively with other team members to progress the evaluation of the many exploration targets and resources under development by St Barbara Atlantic throughout Nova Scotia. 

Primary Duties and Responsibilities including but not limited to:

·      Assist in execution of exploration programs

·      Provide geological support to other technical & geological staff

·      Log core

·      Undertake sampling activities in the field and core yard

·      Ensure a safe working environment at all times

·      Complete other geological activities as assigned

Essential Requirements:

·      Working toward a Geology degree

·      Computer literacy, particularly MS Office Suite products

·      Familiarity with GIS Software (QGIS, MapInfo/Discover, ARCGis), e-Logging Software (LogChief), DBase Software (MS Access, DataShed)

·      Valid Driver’s License

·      Transportation to/from Moose River Gold Mines, NS

Working Conditions:

·      Indoors/outdoors in varying weather conditions

·      Available to work days, evenings and overnights

·      Available to work weekends & holidays

·      Must wear Personal Protective Equipment

 

We would like to thank all those who apply; however only those selected for an interview will be notified

title: Hydrogeologist (Associate Level)
description:
ERM is seeking a motivated intermediate level Hydrogeologist with minimum five years of consulting experience who is interested in participating on a variety of projects covering the full spectrum of ERM’s services, to join our consulting firm in Vancouver or Smithers, BC or Calgary, AB. In this role you will work closely with Project Managers in support of a growing list of projects in Canada and abroad. This is an excellent career opportunity to work with an expert consulting team on challenging environmental projects for large mining, industrial and global clients. Access to ERM's national experts provides knowledge sharing of best practices across the industry and ongoing learning opportunities for our team, while building the required experience to obtain your professional registration.

RESPONSIBILITIES:      

  • Preparing and executing hydrogeology field programs;
  • Developing cost estimates for the hydrogeology field programs (baseline site characterization, ongoing monitoring and other programs);
  • Coordinating with drilling, laboratory and other types of contractors and equipment suppliers, while mobilizing for field programs;
  • Supervising drilling operations, including diamond drilling, other types of drilling, packer testing;
  • Assisting with and supervising downhole geophysical logging/testing;
  • Designing and execution of pump/aquifer tests;
  • Supervising installation of vibrating wire piezometers;
  • Supervising installation of monitoring wells;
  • Developing and sampling monitoring wells with the use of a range of sampling and other supporting equipment;
  • Performing slug tests and pump tests;
  • Installing and operating transducers and data loggers;
  • Processing the collected data (groundwater levels and other types of data, developing hydrographs);
  • Conducting analysis of the collected packer test-, slug test-, and pump/aquifer test data using standard software (like Aqtesolv);
  • Processing the chemical laboratory reports, including calculating relative percent difference, charge balance error, preparing box and whisker charts, Piper diagrams, developing report tables, including statistical summaries;
  • Developing hydrogeology reports; and
  • Assisting with developing proposals.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND PREMIUM SKILLS:

  • Designing hydrogeology field characterization and monitoring programs;
  • Designing monitoring wells, hydraulic test programs;
  • Designing and operating Westbay systems;
  • Developing (or assisting in developing) numerical groundwater models;
  • Designing site investigation programs and remedial action plans for contaminated sites; and
  • Avalanche safety certification and backcountry experience is an asset.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 5+ years of hydrogeology consulting experience with directly related to environmental permitting for mining projects;
  • BASc/MASc/MSc in civil or environmental engineering, earth sciences, or equivalent related field; and
  • PEng/PGeo registration in Canadian jurisdiction(s) or eligible for such registration;
  • Valid driver’s license and good driving record;
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment;
  • Ability to multi-task, maintain flexibility, travel, and work independently with minimal supervision;
  • Excellent problem-solving skills;
  • Effective written/verbal communication and organization/analytical skills; experience recording/writing detailed technical data and reports;
  • Demonstrated attributes to become a strong consultant – team player, eagerness to learn and grow, a self-starter who takes initiative;
  • French or Spanish language skills an asset.

Who We Are:

As the largest global pure play sustainability consultancy, we partner with the world’s leading organizations, creating innovative solutions to sustainability challenges and unlocking commercial opportunities that meet the needs of today while preserving opportunity for future generations.

At ERM we know that creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment is an essential part of making our company a great place to build a career. We also see our diversity as a strength that helps us create better solutions for our clients. Our diverse team of world-class experts supports clients across the breadth of their organizations to operationalize sustainability, underpinned by our deep technical expertise in addressing their environmental, health, safety, risk and social issues. We call this capability our “boots to boardroom” approach for its comprehensive service model that allows ERM to develop strategic and technical solutions that advance objectives on the ground or at the executive level.

Please submit your resume and brief cover letter. Based on review of these responses, shortlisted candidates will be invited for interviews.

ERM welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

ERM is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Thank you for your interest in ERM!

title: Intermediate Hydrogeologist
description:
Terraprobe Inc. is looking for an Intermediate Hydrogeologist to join our team at our BRAMPTON office. The candidate will be a member of a team providing scientific consulting services to private industry and government clients. This position will support a wide variety of projects, and the candidate would be working in the Environmental Department.
 
Responsibilities:
  • Organizes field investigations in support of hydrogeology studies including drilling, well construction, and testing oversight; groundwater and surface water sampling; water level monitoring; hydraulic conductivity testing; and infiltration testing.
  • Designs and construction of groundwater monitoring wells and groundwater supply wells.
  • Develops conceptual site hydrogeologic understanding
  • Analyzes and interpret data including pumping test results, aquifer response, surface water, and groundwater interaction.
  • Prepares technical reports documenting field investigations, analytical results, and interpretation.
  • Assists project managers with developing project budgets, determining project scope, and establishing project schedules.

Requirements:
  • Ability to meet a strong demand for high-quality, organized, and consistent results.
  • Confident individual who demonstrates strong initiative and is capable of independent action with the ability to make informed decisions.
  • Excellent team building and management capabilities, solid oral and written communication skills are desired.
  • Recognized for your high level of technical skills and practical ability to solve problems in various settings.
  • Familiarity with local practice and markets is considered an asset.
  • A valid Driver’s License is required.
  • Education And Experience
  • 5 to 10 years of hydrogeology / consulting experience.
  • Post-secondary educational background, ideally M.Sc., specializing in Hydrogeology/Geology or related field
  • Eligible for professional registration within Ontario.

 Compensation and Benefits:
  • Salary (to be discussed)

At Terraprobe Inc., we know that great experiences start with the right people. We believe that work should be challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also believe that exponential possibilities are more likely to occur with a respectful, satisfying, and empowering company. We value and respect our employees - their experience and expertise as well as their energy, passion, and diversity - and their innovative approach to work and to life.
 
Terraprobe Inc. encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact glaidman@terraprobe.ca or by phone at (905) 796 - 2650. Terraprobe Inc. will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.


About Terraprobe Inc.:

Incorporated in 1977 in Brampton near Toronto (Head Office), Terraprobe also has branch offices in Barrie, Sudbury, and Stoney Creek to serve central and northern Ontario, Canada. Professional staff totals over 200, including over 35 professionals consisting of engineers, geologists, hydrogeologists, and environmental engineers. We provide services in: Design & Investigation Services Geotechnical Engineering Hydrogeological Engineering Environmental Engineering Geostructural Engineering Construction Services Engineering Field Verification / Inspection Materials Testing Excavation Shoring Monitoring Building Sciences / Steel / Roofing Inspection Soil / Concrete / Asphalt Laboratory Testing

title: Geological Technician
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
Reporting to the Senior Geologist, the Geological Technician plays a key role in the safe and efficient collection of quality exploration data including core processing, geophysical surveying and line cutting. The position is based at Noront’s remote Esker Site.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES (including but not limited to):

  • Drill Support - Assist in drill trail and drill pad preparation, down hole orientation surveys, drill core processing, including core moving, Rock Quality Determination, cutting, box labelling, sampling, and shipment.
  • Geophysical Support - Assist with surveying of cut lines and loops using differential GPS and assist with cutting and chaining of grid lines where required.
  • Soil Sampling Support - Assist in the proper collection, marking and bagging of soil samples using hand augers, following the standard operating procedure for soil sampling.
  • Follow health and safety responsibilities, under all applicable government legislations and Noront policies and procedures.
  • Actively participate in and contribute to a Positive Safety Culture on the project including following all Noront and Outland Safe Work Practices and Procedures, wearing and maintaining PPE and participating in Safety Meetings and Training as required.
Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR? 

  • Interest and/or experience in Geology/Mining.
  • Chain Saw Operator certificate is required.
  • Emergency First Aid certificate required.
  • Working knowledge of/experience with snowmobiles and ATVs.
  • Minimum of 2-3 years working in the bush or a remote camp setting.
  • Previous line cutting and geophysical experience is an asset.
  • Working knowledge of drill core handling/storage/cutting, and sampling is an asset.
  • Ability to follow directions and remain adaptable to changing work plans.
  • Ability to work efficiently and productively both independently and as a member of a team.
  • Comfortable working outdoors in all weather conditions.
  • Physically fit and able to handle the following physical demands:
  • Lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs.
  • Walk on un-even terrain, including climbing and while carrying gear.
  • Stand, walk, squat, kneel or sit according to task for extended lengths of time.


Additional Information

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? 

  • All meals and accommodations provided while working at site. 
  • Geological Technicians work on a 2-weeks in/2-weeks off rotational schedule. You are expected to work weekdays, weekends, and general holidays during your 2-week shift.           
  • Wages are paid on an hourly basis on an Overtime Averaging Agreement. Specific pay details are discussed at the interview phase.   
  • Outland and Noront are both well-established companies with strong roots in northern Ontario. Outland and Noront prioritize the development of our northern workforces and provide opportunity for growth and advancement within our organizations.

Dexterra  Group is  an  equal  opportunity  employer  committed  to  diversity  and  inclusion.  We  are  pleased  to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Geology Field Technician
description:
We are St Barbara. A growing gold company with a global outlook. ​

We’re an Australian based, ASX 200 company with gold mining operations in Australia, Canada and Papua New Guinea. Our vision is to be a brilliant, global mining company that grows sustainably and creates enduring, positive impacts.

Our Atlantic Operations Touqouy mine site is located an hour outside of Halifax, Nova Scotia. Situated in Canada’s Ocean Playground, it’s no surprise that Nova Scotian’s quality of life is second to none. Whether you prefer sandy beaches and coastal cliffs, or the culture and energy of city life, you’re never far from either. Halifax is one of the fastest growing cities in Canada and has been rated by Maclean’s Magazine as Canada’s best place to live and work.

Now is an exciting time for our business and for our people. We’re going through a period of significant change and have gained real momentum in transforming our business so that, together, we can build a brilliant future. We’re looking for people who are ready to grow through opportunity and build brilliance with us.​

We are currently seeking a Geology Field Technician to join our team. This is a 12 month term contract with our Atlantic Operations based at our Touquoy mine. This position works a 4 day on, 4 day off 12 hour shift schedule. Reporting to the Mine Geology Superintendent, your role will be to support mine geology field operations including RC drilling supervision, sample transportation and data collection while ensuring all safe work practices are followed.

The Opportunity:

  • Attend daily toolbox talks and ensure proper communication Geology department and Drilling Contractor of Grade Control sampling as outlined in the Geology procedures.
  • Supervise the Drilling Contractor and ensure compliance with the company H&S procedures.
  • Attend daily toolbox talks and ensure proper communication Geology department and Drilling Contractor.
  • Sample handling and delivery to the lab.
  • Preparation of sample bags.
  • Data acquisition and data management.
  • Assist the Mine Geologists with field duties.
  • Be a visible safety leader in the field who can follow and improve safety processes
  • All other duties as may be assigned.

Are you ready to come and build a brilliant future with us?

We need the very best people. People who genuinely care for the work they do and the positive impact they can make. People who see challenge as an opportunity for growth and value working with others towards a common goal.​

We would love to hear from you if you have:

  • A personal commitment to behavior consistent with St Barbara's Values including honesty and integrity, respect, working together, delivering to promise and striving to do better.
  • Bachelor of Science in Geology or a related field of studies.
  • At least one year relevant of mineral exploration experience preferable in orogenic gold environments.
  • Experience with Mine Software packages is considered an asset.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Suite especially Excel.
  • Experience with survey equipment considered an asset.
  • Class 5 Drivers License.
  • Ability to pass a background check.

For further information on St Barbara and to apply for this role, please visit: https://stbarbara.com.au/working-with-us/current-opportunities/

At St Barbara, we’re committed to finding the best fit for every role. We are a diverse and inclusive workplace, welcoming diversity in all its forms. All qualified applicants will be given equal consideration, regardless of their race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity. We are the only Australian mining company to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for seven consecutive years. 

We encourage Members of the Mi’ kmaq community to self-identify in their cover letter.

title: Géologue, Sénior
description:
Company Description

Nous sommes SGS – Le leader mondial des services d’essais, d’inspection et de certification. Nous sommes reconnus comme la référence mondiale en matière de qualité et d'intégrité. Nos 89 000 employés opèrent un réseau de 2 600 bureaux et laboratoires, travaillant ensemble pour permettre un monde meilleur, sécuritaire et plus interconnecté.


Job Description

RESPONSABILITÉS PRINCIPALES

La/le géologue/ingénieur(e)-géologue sénior doit établir des méthodes pour respecter les horaires de travail et coordonner les activités de travail avec les clients et le personnel technique. Il/elle est également responsable de mettre en œuvre toutes les exigences nécessaires en matière de planification, d’ordonnancement et de coordination pour effectuer et surveiller un projet ou une campagne.

RESPONSABILITÉS SPÉCIFIQUES
Opérations
•    Préparer et rédiger des rapports techniques selon les exigences de l’instrument national 43-101.
•    Mettre en œuvre de nouvelles méthodologies pour des projets en phase de conception, en étude de préfaisabilité et de faisabilité, et pour les projets opérationnels existants.
•    Avoir de très bonnes connaissances et de l’expérience dans les opérations qui incluent : les projets de forage, la planification des mines, la planification de projets, l’ordonnancement et le contrôle des exploitations minières, la sous-traitance en exploitation minière, et la gestion des mines à ciel ouvert dans les zones à forte pluviosité. 
•    Utilisation de logiciels de modélisation pouvant inclure : Genesis, Gems, Surpac, Datamine, et Excel.
•    Capacité à gérer une équipe sur le terrain composée de foreurs et de techniciens, entre autres.
•    Surveiller les activités des équipes de travail et des entrepreneurs.
•    Gérer tous les aspects des projets de forage. 
•    Connaissance de la production et du développement de modèles géologiques.
•    Établir et maintenir des relations avec les clients. 
•    Capacité à rédiger des rapports techniques clairs et concis.
•    Communiquer tous les problèmes importants liés aux opérations, à la gestion environnementale et à la sécurité.
•    Possibilité de déplacements vers d’autres laboratoires de SGS au Canada ou à l’étranger, pour des affectations à court ou à long terme.
•    Certains projets spéciaux ou ponctuels peuvent être assignés à l’occasion selon les besoins.
 


Qualifications

PROFIL

•    Formation : baccalauréat en géologie ou en génie géologique.
•    Expérience : un minimum de 12 ans d’expérience dans le domaine de la géologie.

COMPÉTENCES REQUISES

•    Diplôme universitaire dans un programme lié aux sciences ou en génie, avec une préférence marquée dans le domaine des géosciences (géologie, mines, minéralogie, minéralogie environnementale, sciences des sols, etc.).
•    Un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience technique dans un poste lié aux géosciences, y compris certains aspects de la gestion des affaires et du personnel.
•    Connaissances approfondies de l’industrie minière et des minéraux.  
•    Une affiliation à une association de géologues ou d’ingénieurs est une exigence pour ce poste à titre de personne qualifiée (PQ) conformément à l’instrument national 43-101.
•    Posséder d’excellentes compétences en gestion et en leadership et démontrer une capacité à diriger et à gérer les ressources humaines.
•    Capacité à travailler sans surveillance immédiate. 
•    Avoir d’excellentes habiletés organisationnelles, interpersonnelles et de communication.  
•    Certains postes exigent la maîtrise d’autres langues que l’anglais (le français, l’espagnol, le russe, l’arabe, etc.).  
•    Capacité à lire, comprendre et bien suivre les instructions de travail en respectant les consignes de sécurité et les délais établis. 
•    Faire preuve d’excellentes habiletés de communications verbales et écrites, y compris la grammaire et la rédaction de textes.
•    Maîtriser l’utilisation de différents types de logiciels (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, AutoCAD).
•    Avoir de l’expérience avec MS Project Management et les applications Oracle serait un atout.
•    Maîtriser l’utilisation de l’un des logiciels spécialisés suivants (GEOSTAT, GEMCOM, SURPAC, DATAMINE, SURPAC MINEX).
•    Capacité à gérer et à coordonner plusieurs projets à la fois dans un environnement très dynamique et professionnel. 
•    Aptitude reconnue à gérer et à coordonner plusieurs projets à la fois dans un environnement très dynamique et professionnel.
•    Capacité à travailler en situation de groupe et de façon autonome. 
•    Compétences reconnues en matière de gestion du temps et avoir un grand souci du détail.
•    Capacité à bien travailler sous pression.
•    Les heures de travail prolongées et les quarts de travail peuvent être requis à l’occasion.
•    Avoir un passeport valide et à jour pour les déplacements à prévoir.
•    Les déplacements vers les autres sites de SGS ou des clients sont à prévoir à l’occasion.
•    Assurer le respect absolu des politiques de l’entreprise à l’égard de la santé et sécurité au travail, du Code d’intégrité et du Code de conduite professionnelle.


Additional Information

SGS Canada est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et nous nous engageons à assurer une plus grande accessibilité en fournissant des mesures d’adaptation pour les personnes handicapées au cours de notre processus d’embauche. Les mesures d’adaptation sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qualifiés au cours de chaque étape du processus de recrutement.

Veuillez noter que les candidats/candidates qui postulent aux offres d’emploi au Canada doivent être autorisés/autorisées à travailler au Canada

description:
Brock Canada Industrial Ltd is hiring Scaffolders - All Levels for a project AT MEG ENERGY

The main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • CSTS -09 or CSO
  • Fall Protection,
  • H2s alive,
  • Confined Space
We are offering attractive TRAVEL INCENTIVE!!!!

If you think you'll be a good fit, apply with your resume and safety tickets before the spots get filled.
