title: Geologist - Ferrous Exploration (Fixed Term - Seasonal)
description:
Mission for this Position:

About Us

 

At Baffinland, we work and live beyond the Arctic Circle, mining iron ore at our Mary River Property, located in the Qikiqtani Region of Nunavut on Baffin Island; one of the worldâ€™s most captivating and seldom seen destinations. We are a unique company with a strong management who have amassed specialty experience on northern mining projects through all phases of Inuit consultation, permitting, construction and operation. Our workforce brings together the modern practice of safe, sustainable mining and the enduring value of a traditional culture, which is rapidly advancing. The result is a work and community experience you won't find anywhere else. We are looking for people ready to share, build, and grow with our company.

 

Reporting to the Ferrous Project Geologists, assist with the execution of Baffinlandâ€™s Ferrous exploration program. Under the supervision of the Ferrous Exploration Manager and Ferrous Project Geologists, in collaboration with other Geologists, execute the Ferrous exploration programs in such a manner that ensures the operational and health and safety goals are successfully attained.

 

The position is site based with 3 weeks on / 3 weeks off rotation and will be on a fixed term contract from May 2022 - October 2022.

Main Accountabilities:
  • Follow and adhere to Baffinlandâ€™s Environment, Health and Safety Policies and Standards at all times.
  • Geotechnical and lithological logging, geochemical sample preparation, database entry
  • Performing downhole surveys
  • Detailed core logging
  • Assist with core storage and retrieval
  • Assist with the preparation of reports, maps & sections
  • Assist with drill site environment, health and safety checks to ensure compliance by drill contractors
  • Conducting prospecting traverses, collection and processing surface samples
  • General camp duties that may occur in the course of supporting Exploration programs
Main Qualifications:
  • Bachelors Degree Earth Science or Geology.
  • 3-5 field seasons and or drill campaigns.  
  • Core logging experience required.
  • Registered as a GIT or have the ability to do so in Nunavut.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Knowledge of industry standard database and GIS software.
  • Hold or be able to obtain a valid Standard First Aid / CPR certificate.
  • Hold or be able to obtain a site drivers license.
  • Ability to lift and carry ~30 kg of boxed core

title: Senior Geologist
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Environmental Geologist for a well established engineering consulting client of ours. This position can be worked remotely but the candidate should be based in BC. This role s primarily involved in contaminated site project work including investigation, characterization and remediation of sites, waste management, and other environmental studies, primarily focused on metal leachate / acid rock drainage issues.

Advantages
-Excellent compensations and Benefits (including company share ownership plan and pension plan)
-Opportunities for career advancement
-Diverse project portfolio


Responsibilities
-Preparing proposals, developing work plans and budgets and managing projects
-Planning, coordination, and execution of field programs typically associated with geological field mapping, identifying metal leachate (ML) / acid rock drainage (ARD) issues, contaminated soil and groundwater investigations and assessment in alignment with regulatory requirements
-Technical and regulatory support for engineered encapsulation or blending designs for ML and/or Potentially Acid Generating (PAG) rock , waste characterization and waste disposal planning; Preparation of cost-benefit analysis regarding the mitigation of metal leaching and/or potentially acid generating rock
-Development of preparing prediction and prevention plan reports and/or material management plan reports, and prediction of future leachate and potential impacts on human and/or ecological receptors
-Report preparation
-Provide guidance, training, and direction to junior staff
-Developing and managing relationships with clients, regulatory agencies
-Identifying business opportunities in BC and Western Canada;
-Promoting Health and Safety programs and culture

Qualifications
-Bachelor or master’s degree in geological engineering, with understanding/experience in metal leachate (ML) / acid rock drainage (ARD)
-Registered or the ability to register as a Professional Engineer and/or Professional Geologist in British Columbia
-Strong understanding and demonstrable experience with geological field mapping in British Columbia which may include: structural measurements, lithology descriptions, mineralogical interpretation, petrogenesis interpretations, inferring geological boundaries and illustrating field data on figures
-Demonstrable experience overseeing collection of soil, rock and/or water samples and submit for laboratory testing
-Experience with engineered encapsulation or blending designs for ML and/or Potentially Acid Generating (PAG) rock
-Experience working in a consulting environment
-Strong written and verbal communication skills in the English language; French language skills are an asset
-Solid organization and time management abilities
-Strong interpersonal skills combined with a positive, team-oriented attitude with a drive to succeed
-Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
-Strong knowledge of and experience applying relevant environmental regulations including the Environmental
-Management Act, Contaminated Sites Regulation, Hazardous Waste Regulation, would be considered and asset

Summary
If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please forward your resume via email to Nick Paraskeva | nick.paraskeva@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Principal Geologist
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood currently has an opportunity for a Principal Geologist to build our capability in country and work closely with our client on a Magnetite Concentrator in Uzbekistan. This position has responsibility for executing technical consulting studies in mining & minerals projects through the project development life cycle working closely with Wood offices around the world on several simultaneous projects. This position requires strong technical, managerial and business leadership skills. The candidate shall be comfortable working in a multi-disciplinary environment providing engineering expertise in Iron Ore, and/or base metals operations and engineering organizations with roles of increasing responsibility in the mining and consulting industry. A key component of the role is assisting the client to investigate and implement the best for project execution strategy. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Wood serves many of the world leaders in the mining industry. The company maintains mining offices across Canada, the USA and Australia, as well as in Santiago, Chile, Lima, Peru and Johannesburg, South Africa and Uzbekistan.

 

Responsibilities

  • Working very closely with the client team to develop the optimal fast track project execution plan
  • Working closely with Wood offices globally to develop and deliver the necessary studies and projects
  • Training the client team regarding project mining study and project execution
  • Executing and providing guidance to our resource geologists and engineers in the matters of resource estimation; including, geological data quality assurance, geological modeling, geostatistics, mineral resource classification, production geology, resource reconciliation and resource risks and opportunities
  • Performing geological and mineral resource/reserves reviews audits and due diligence assessments to maximize value for our clients
  • Ensuring compliance of resource estimates with international professional standards and government regulations for public disclosures by working with Wood Technical Directors and regulatory compliance specialists
  • Actively supporting business development activities through participation in conferences, direct business development activities and strategic client relationship management
  • Review and audit of exploration and pre-development programs
  • Planning and recommendations for ongoing resource work
  • Reviews of geological and resource data and modeling
  • Reviews of grade control procedures and results
  • Reconciliation reviews and due diligence studies
  • Site inspections and procedural audits

Skills / Qualifications

  • Undergraduate or Graduate Degree in Geology, Geostatistics, Geological or Mining Engineering or mining-related field.
  • More than 15 years of experience of increasing responsibility in conducting exploration and evaluation programs, drill programs, geologic interpretation and modeling and resource and reserve estimation.
  • Industry recognition as an expert in geology and resource estimation.
  • Experience in the 3D modeling and grade estimation of a variety of mineral deposits.
  • Familiarity with various geological modeling and resource estimation software packages, such as Leapfrog, MineSight, Vulcan, and Datamine.
  • Knowledge of industry standards in mineral resource and mineral reserve estimation.
  • Willingness to be based in Tashkent (Uzbekistan) and travel both domestically and internationally, for varying durations and at times to remote locations.
  • Fluent in English and Russian.

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Géologue de chantier - Mécanique des roches
description:
Géologue de chantier – Mécanique des roches

Joignez-vous à un chef de file mondial en services professionnels. Nous sommes engagés à résoudre les plus grands défis mondiaux dans les secteurs de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation.

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un Géologue de chantier spécialisé en mécanique des roches pour se joindre à notre équipe du bureau de Montréal, afin de contribuer à la réalisation de nombreux travaux d'excavations à ciel ouvert et souterraines. 

Principales responsabilités
•    Cartographie de roc et analyse structurale en chantier (fondations, parois rocheuses à ciel ouvert et tunnels et espaces souterraines) selon les classifications géomécaniques courantes (GSI, Q, RMR);
•    Réaliser le suivi technique pour assurer la qualité des travaux exécutés (excavation, forages, consolidation pour stabilisation de parois rocheuses, pose de boulons et/ou d'ancrages, injections, mise en place de béton de projeté, essais in situ, etc), assurer la coordination des travaux de suivi de chantier (instrumentation géotechnique et autres) et assurer la bonne communication avec le client;
•    Compilation de données techniques en lien avec la caractérisation de massifs rocheux;
•    Réalisation en chantier de vérifications et d'essais divers (vérifications de fond d'excavation au roc, essais d'arrachement d'ancrages au roc);
•    Supervision de divers travaux d'excavation, incluant la mise en place de sytèmes de soutènement temporaires ou permanents;
•    Description structurale de carottes de roc au laboratoire;
•    Identification en laboratoire de minéraux en lien avec la qualité des matériaux de construction (réactions alcali-granulats, pyrite, pyrrhotite, etc.);
•    Rédaction de différents rapports techniques au chantier, au bureau, et au laboratoire, selon le cas;
•    Collaborer avec des équipes multidisciplinaires;

Formation et compétences
•    Baccalauréat en géologie ou l'équivalent;
•    Connaissances en mécanique des roches et particulières en suivi de construction d'excavation rocheuse à ciel ouvert et en souterrain (tunnel et caverne);
•    Expérience minimum de 3 ans d'expérience dans le domaine;
•    Bon français parlé et écrit;
•    Être membre de l'Ordre des géologues du Québec (OGQ);
•    Détention d'une carte ASP Construction valide
•    Détention d'un permis de conduire valide

Pourquoi choisir GHD?
Notre culture consiste à toujours donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. 
Nous sommes une famille de gens intelligents, innovateurs, créatifs et passionnés par la résolution de problèmes. Dans notre entreprise détenue par ses employés, tout nous tient davantage à cœur. Lancez-nous des défis et aidez-nous à trouver de nouvelles solutions pour assurer la durabilité de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation pour les générations à venir. 

Notre engagement envers vous
« Engagement » est un mot puissant qui définit notre façon de faire des affaires, de servir nos clients et de nous soucier du bien-être de chacun. Nous vous fournirons les outils dont vous avez besoin pour exceller et nous soulignerons vos réussites. Nous vous laisserons donner libre cours à votre curiosité pour permettre aux esprits brillants d’accomplir le meilleur travail possible. Nous investirons dans de nouvelles idées et éliminerons les obstacles autant que possible. Enfin, nous vous encouragerons à collaborer avec des milliers d’autres personnes diversifiées dans l’ensemble de notre entreprise mondiale.

Qui nous sommes
Nous sommes engagés à résoudre les plus grands défis mondiaux dans les secteurs de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation. GHD est une entreprise de services professionnels dotée d’une expertise de pointe en ingénierie, en construction et en architecture. Fondée en 1928, GHD appartient entièrement à ses employés. Nous sommes plus de 10 000 employés diversifiés et qualifiés, unis sous la bannière GHD dans plus de 200 bureaux et sur cinq continents : Amérique du Nord et Amérique du Sud, Asie, Australie et Europe, ainsi que dans la région du Pacifique. En livrant d’excellents résultats sociaux et économiques, nous visons à bâtir des relations durables avec nos partenaires et nos clients. 

En tant qu’organisation diversifiée et inclusive, nous encourageons les réalisations individuelles et reconnaissons la force d’un milieu de travail diversifié. GHD est un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Sur demande, GHD fournira des mesures d’adaptation raisonnables pour les candidats handicapés tout au long du processus de recrutement et de sélection.

title: Principal Resource Geologist (Mid-Senior Level)
description:
CSA Global, an ERM Group Company, is a geological, mining and management consulting company that provides strategic mining services and independent corporate advice to companies worldwide. The Resources division is a highly regarded global leader in the provision of resource estimation services. Our international group consists of over 25 resource geologists backed by experience in almost all deposit styles. CSA Global prides itself on providing an integrated approach across the mine value chain with an emphasis on geoscience, innovative solutions and adding value to our clients’ projects.

We are looking for a passionate, committed, and professional Principal Resource Geologist to join our Vancouver or Toronto team. As part of the Resources team, you will have the unique opportunity to work across a large variety of global projects and have strong working relationships with the global team. Our company provides global focus yet is small enough to be agile and for individuals to make a difference.

The successful person in this position will provide technical expertise and their primary responsibilities will include: managing and executing resource evaluation projects; managing project budgets and deliverables to ensure timely and high quality consulting services; networking and business development; and provision of innovative and creative solutions to meet our client’s needs.

We are looking for positive, enthusiastic people who have the following attributes:

  • Authentic and professional communication that displays confidence, competency, and a desire to understand our client’s requirements.
  • High level of geological knowledge regarding multiple commodities (gold, copper, lead, zinc, bauxite, iron ore, etc.).
  • High level of Mineral Resource estimation skills; experience in advanced geostatistics is desirable.
  • Experience reviewing quality assurance procedures and quality control data.
  • Competent with 3D Modelling of geological features.
  • Strong software capability with at least one but preferably a number of the main mining packages: e.g. Leapfrog Geo/Edge, Datamine, Micromine, Surpac, Supervisor, Isatis etc.
  • Thorough knowledge of NI43-101 reporting requirements and familiarity with codes from other jurisdictions (JORC, SAMREC).
  • Willingness to participate in site visits (domestic and international) and laboratory inspections.
  • An understanding and respect of health and safety, which is demonstrated through behavior.
  • To be registered and in good standing with one or more of the provincial Canadian Engineering regulatory bodies (PGeo), and added beneficial registration with AusIMM or other important international engineering societies.
  • Tertiary degree in Geology/Mining (PhD and MSc well regarded).
  • Valid working rights in Canada.

To excel in this role, it is essential that you have technical ability and are passionate about and have proficiency in business development.  CSA Global has its own style of business development, where networks and integrity are critical.  These attributes must be central to the way you approach business development.  The successful person must be client-centric with a mantra of wanting to provide great-service, delivering top-quality work, and adding value in everything we do.

The company offers a flexible, dynamic and team focused work environment where people’s expertise and interests are matched with projects to provide them with the freedom to succeed.  While having a global focus, the team is small enough to be agile and for individuals to make a big difference.  The company prides itself on being a value driven organisation. We care about employees’ wellbeing, everyone’s opinion matters, and we still remember to have fun.

Who We Are:

As the largest global pure play sustainability consultancy, we partner with the world’s leading organizations, creating innovative solutions to sustainability challenges and unlocking commercial opportunities that meet the needs of today while preserving opportunity for future generations.

Our diverse team of world-class experts supports clients across the breadth of their organizations to operationalize sustainability, underpinned by our deep technical expertise in addressing their environmental, health, safety, risk and social issues. We call this capability our “boots to boardroom” approach for its comprehensive service model that allows ERM to develop strategic and technical solutions that advance objectives on the ground or at the executive level.

Please submit your resume and brief cover letter. 

ERM welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

ERM is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Thank you for your interest in ERM!

title: Oracle HCM/ Taleo Consultant
description:
Oracle HCM/ Taleo Consultant Roles & Responsibilities 

  • Participate in the translation of the customer's needs into deliverables, the preparation of documentation and presentations
  • Parameterize the modules for the implementation of a functional solution adapted to the customer's needs
  • Accompany the project team in the deployment or evolution of the solution
  • Prepare and lead design workshops on the subjects mastered
  • Control the quality of the service provided to the client
  • Developments on the tool, tests and receipts
  • Ensure technical maintenance
  • Carry out technical monitoring, train users
  • Advise customers on solution evolutions and their implementation

 

Required Professional Expertise  

  • You have more than 2 years of experience in HRIS in a consulting firm or in a company and have knowledge of Oracle HCM Cloud, Taleo, Talentsoft, SAP SuccessFactors or Workday HCM software.
  • Your level of English is fluent

title: Intermediate Geochemist
description:
At Golder, we thrive on challenges.

Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder has a new opportunity for an Intermediate Geochemist to join our Mine Water & Environment team on a full-time basis based in Vancouver.

The selected candidate will support geochemistry-related projects and proposal efforts with an emphasis on the mining industry in Canada. Projects typically involve permitting, baseline studies, operational support, and reclamation/remediation.

An overview of your role will include:

  • Providing support for geochemical projects, specifically in mining environments
  • Conducting geochemical characterization studies of mine wastes (ore, waste rock, gases, and water), radiological assessments, and other environmental investigations
  • Mentoring junior staff with data analysis and reporting
  • Coordinating and liaising with laboratories on geochemical and mineralogical analyses
  • Planning and coordination of field and laboratory testing activities
  • Collection, management, and analysis of geochemical data
  • Data interpretation and conceptual model development
  • Report preparation including figures, tables, and presentations
  • Demonstrating a "Safety-First" focus
  • Maintaining a high standard of behavior to uphold Golder's reputation and demonstrating a commitment to our Core Values
You will have a background in:
  • Advanced degree in Geochemistry (MSc or PhD) with a focus on Geology, Environmental Science, Geological Engineering, or related field - ideally with a strong quantitative background
  • 5 to 10 years applied work experience in geochemical assessments within natural or mine-affected sites
  • Strong understanding of mineralogy, geology, and chemistry
  • Academic knowledge of surface water and groundwater interactions, hydrology, and hydrogeology
  • Familiarity with industry-standard modeling software such as PHREEQC, Geochemist's Workbench, and GoldSim would be considered an asset
  • Strong data manipulation abilities including experience with data management tools (i.e., Excel, EQuIS, Access)
  • Strong relational skills within the team environment and with clients are essential
  • Excellent organizational and communications skills

Your benefits at Golder will include:

  • Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
  • Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
  • Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching
  • Global projects and travel opportunities

One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 13 consecutive years

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Golder Associates Ltd. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), and all other applicable legislation. Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities upon request.

To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.

title: Principal Hydrogeologist - Australia
description:
• Relocate with WSP Australia
  • Competitive salary packages on offer
  • Visa and relocation support offered
  • Join our growing Mining Services Team

About us

With approximately 55,000 talented people globally and 6,100 across more than 50 offices in Australia and New Zealand, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for lifetimes to come. We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international brainpower.

We have recently joined forces with Golder, making WSP the largest environmental consulting firm globally, with over 14,000 environment professionals. Together, we can accelerate our global Environmental, Social & Governance vision, and make an impact on our built and natural environment.

The Opportunity

WSP and Golder coming together has strengthened our capability and is enabling like-minded professionals to collaborate more easily; better leveraging technology and accessing a broader client base.

As a result of growth, and an increased demand for services in the Mine Water sector, we are currently seeking a Principal Hydrogeologist to join our team to be based in Australia.

What you will do

  • Delivery of groundwater management advice to internal and external clients predominantly in the mining industry.
  • The technical oversight and review of hydrogeological support for complex groundwater projects around the globe.
  • Managing projects including project scoping, budget control, planning, development of schedules and coordination of resources to meet completion deadlines.
  • Developing and managing best practice approaches and technologies for hydrogeological assessment and related decision-making, while keeping abreast of advancing technologies methods and research & development.
  • Leading, mentoring, and coaching colleagues with respect to their career growth and technical professional development and actively transfer knowledge.
  • Drive innovation in our practice with new techniques, workflows, and ideas.

What we are looking for

  • Tertiary-qualified with a Bachelor’s degree in Geology, Engineering or related discipline; a Post-graduate degree in Hydrogeology will be highly regarded.
  • Excellent data interpretation and problem-solving skills.
  • High level of technical report writing, other written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and verbal communications abilities. 
  • Demonstrated experience in the consulting industry with business acumen.
  • Demonstrated experience in the delivery of hydrogeological assessments to characterise and address complex groundwater problems.
  • Machine learning and coding background (e.g., Python, Matlab etc.) will be highly regarded.
  • Passionate about hydrogeology.
  • Strong commitment to HSSE, mental health and developing a safe workspace for everyone.

Some of the many benefits we offer our employees include:

  • Professional and technical development opportunities
  • Flexible working hours and working from home.
  • Global mobility.
  • Parental leave & purchased additional annual leave.
  • Corporate employee discounts and offers.
  • Salary continuance insurance.
  • Wellness at work & social club.
  • Workplace giving /volunteering.
  • Employee reward & recognition program.

Inspired by Diversity, Driven by Inclusion…….

Discover a forward-thinking culture that incorporates some conventional yet non-negotiable qualities—like respect, integrity and trust. We welcome to the table all perspectives, strengths, skills, creeds and genders because we know that diverse ideas breed extraordinary results.

WSP supports a diverse and inclusive work environment as well as equal employment opportunities. W

If you want to have a confidential conversation about the role feel free to get in touch with Jeremy Olaivar at

http://Jeremy.Olaivar@wsp.com/

Please note we will not be engaging the services of recruitment agencies for this role.

title: Groundwater Modeler/Hydrogeologist
description:
At Woodard & Curran there’s nothing we love more than a tough engineering challenge. We handle a wide range of water and environmental issues—solving complex problems with creativity and tenacity. That’s how we make a difference to our clients, people, and planet. Our company was founded on a simple concept: provide a safe and enjoyable place to work with opportunity, integrity, and commitment, and we will attract talented people. Those people are at the heart of our firm, solving some of the most pressing water and environmental challenges for our clients.

Overview:

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a water resources engineer or hydrogeologist interested in developing innovative solutions to challenging water-related projects, and working with successful project teams. This opportunity will be based in California, specific office location is flexible. The selected candidate will have experience in the water resources and groundwater fields, exceptional communication skills, the ability to interact with clients and stakeholder groups, and experience managing projects and project teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Development of hydrogeologic conceptual models.
  • Development and calibration of regional hydrologic and groundwater models and application to water resources projects.
  • Development, calibration and application of groundwater quality models.
  • Interpreting model results to support policy and regulatory processes.
  • Performing data analysis, visualization, mapping and management with an emphasis on water resources data.
  • Performing groundwater management and planning, land use analysis, agricultural and urban water analysis.
  • Developing code to support and analyze modeling projects.

Qualifications:

  • The candidate must be a proactive communicator, both internally and externally, and work with both junior and senior project staff.
  • BS in Water Resources Engineering, Hydrology, Hydrogeology, Environmental Science or a related field, MS/PhD preferred.
  • Strong theoretical background on numerical analysis, hydrogeology, groundwater flow, and water quality.
  • Proficiency with CA Department of Water Resources (DWR’s) Integrated Water Resources Model (IWFM) and/or U.S. Geological Survey’s (USGS’s) MODFLOW modeling platforms.
  • Experience working on water resources, groundwater and/or closely related projects; specific experience with local, regional, and watershed scale modeling and planning projects is highly desirable.
  • Excellent organizational, writing, presentation and interpersonal skills.

Woodard & Curran is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

Woodard & Curran is a Drug Free Work Place.

Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

PLEASE USE A WEB BROWSER OTHER THAN INTERNET EXPLORER IF YOU ENCOUNTER ISSUES (CHROME, FIREFOX, SAFARI)

title: Intermediate Hydrogeologist - (Job Number: CAL00YR)
description:
Intermediate Hydrogeologist

Company: Advisian
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Calgary
Job: Environmental<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: Apr 11, 2022
Unposting Date: May 12, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Principal Hydrogeologist

Intermediate Hydrogeologist


Advisian, Worley Group


Calgary, Cold Lake, Edmonton, Alberta


Advisian is the independent consulting business line of the Worley Group with more than 2,000 people in 19 countries. We provide solutions for clients across a range of industries, including ports and marine terminals, renewable energy, mining, and onshore and offshore oil and gas. As part of one of the worldrsquo;s largest engineering firms, we continue to push boundaries and extend our capabilities globally. Worley is a company that prides itself on providing safe and high-quality services that exceed our customerrsquo;s expectations, which is why we manage some of the world#39;s leading projects.


This is a full-time position located in one of our Alberta offices. Our Groundwater Practice within the Water Service Line is seeking an energetic, dynamic and motivated mid-level hydrogeologist with strong technical and communication skills who is eager to join a growing group of professional hydrogeologists. The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 yearsrsquo; experience in consulting hydrogeology, excellent time management and priority setting skills, flexibility, and sound interpersonal skills. The successful candidate will carry out varied hydrogeologic field and office assignments requiring a familiarity of a range of groundwater projects, including participating in project planning, as well as field execution and coordination, data analysis, and reporting, under the guidance of Senior and Principal Hydrogeologists.


Responsibilities, and Key Accountabilities

      • Record, evaluate and interpret geologic/hydrogeologic (environmental) data, prepare technical reports, work plans, and conduct analysis and interpretation of findings for hydrogeological characterization and assessment.
      • Task mangement and safe execution of groundwater field programs, including groundwater monitoring; supervision of contractors on site; drilling, borehole logging and monitoring well installations; and tracking and reporting on field activities.
      • Coordinate and manage subcontractors to ensure safe completion of site activities.
      • Provide technical support for a variety of projects by working with subject matter experts to apply and develop knowledge and skills in areas that focus on groundwater resources, including physical and chemical hydrogeology, groundwater permitting, groundwater remediation and restoration, hydrogeological assessments, groundwater resources and sustainability, and environmental impact assessment.
      • The preferred candidate will take initiative and possess excellent communication and writing skills, with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with excellent time-management skills.
      • Have a strong desire to develop as a consultant (team player, eagerness to learn and grow, self-starter that takes initiative, is adaptable, and provides a high quality of work).
      • Be detail-oriented, able to follow instructions, and communicate with staff to understand assignments or seek clarification as necessary.
      • Able/keen to build and main strong relationships with key clients with respect to their technical area and the broader business objectives in their regions.
      • Endeavor to understand client needs and how the project relates to other elements of the client#39;s organization and to other projects.
      • Contribute to identify and develop new business opportunities.

Qualifications

      • Diploma or Bachelorrsquo;s degree (preferred) in hydrogeology, geology, or related discipline
      • Minimum 5 years of demontrated experience in environmental/engineering/water resources consulting.
      • Experience in the design and execution of drilling projects (mud rotary, sonic, auger, direct push), including planning, coordination, logging, and well design.
      • Experience in the field executing well sampling programs utilizing traditional and alternative sampling methods (i.e. no-purge, low flow, and dissolved gas sampling).
      • Ability to work primarily in a rugged, physically demanding field environment.
      • Demonstrated experience in aquifer testing programs, including planning and execution of pumping tests.
      • Experience with in-situ operations and thermal mobilization regulation would be considered an asset.
      • Excellent organizational skills and be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously, and under pressure.
      • Strong commitment to safety, including following established Health and Safety protocols.
      • Demonstrated focus on continual improvement, including identification of areas for improvement and implementation of actions.
      • Practical knowledge of working outdoors and mechanical aptitude are considered assets.
      • Experience with project management and client liason would be considered an asset.
      • Candidates must pocess a valid Class 5 full driverrsquo;s licence with a clean driving record.

Advisian (a part of Worley) offers an excellent remuneration amp; benefits package, a friendly, professional, dynamic, and flexible work environment along with the opportunity to develop your career prospects within the US, Canada, and overseas.


We strive to be an industry leader in health, safety and environmental performance. Our vision is to achieve zero harm to people and assets, and zero environmental incidents. We select people who share our values, beliefs and commitment to this vision and who demonstrate the expected behaviours, competencies and performance associated with their prospective roles within the company.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Worley operating as Advisian is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Manager, Hydrology / Water Resources
location: North Vancouver Or New Westminster, BC
description:
Hatfield has been awardedBC’s Top Employers for 2022and we're looking for more outstanding people to join our team! We do interesting and meaningful work with opportunities for career and professional growth. We also offer a competitive compensation package, flexible work hours, vacation allowances, and comprehensive health benefits including extended health coverage, an employee and family assistance program, and a RRSP matching plan.

Hatfield is seeking an experienced, technically strong and driven individual to join the leadership team of our BC Water Resource Group (WRG). This position will be based out of our North Vancouver or New Westminster offices and also work collaboratively with and support our teams in Calgary and Fort McMurray.

The successful candidate will possess significant experience and technical expertise in at least one of the following disciplines:

  • Hydrology;
  • Climatology;
  • Water Management;
  • Water Resource Engineering; or
  • Water quality modelling.

The ideal candidate will also have knowledge of the environmental consulting market in British Columbia and an interest in developing business related to these water disciplines.

Location:North Vancouver or New Westminster, BC – This is a full-time permanent position.

Technical Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Manage a team of water resource technicians, specialists and scientists responsible for conducting technical work, which may include but is not limited to hydrologic, hydrogeologic and climate baseline characterization, water resource evaluation, modelling and impact assessment, and operational compliance monitoring studies.
  • Manage projects, including: serving as primary client contact; preparing or reviewing technical analysis, reports and documents; general meetings/presentations with/to clients and regulators/interest groups; scheduling; budget development and tracking; and providing technical or regulatory guidance and advice.
  • Lead the development and implementation of local business development and marketing plans and support regional WRG initiatives. This would include the preparation of technical and financial proposals as required for current and prospective clients.
  • Provide senior technical support, as required or requested. This would include collaboration with other professionals, scientists, and environmental managers on multi-disciplinary projects.

Administrative Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Liaise with Hatfield senior managers and partners on financial and human resource management issues.
  • Lead, supervise, mentor, and train employees.
  • Develop and maintain client relationships.
  • Ensure compliance of Hatfield’s Health and Safety Management Plan, the law, and client health and safety protocols, as well as compliance with Hatfield’s Quality Management Plan and external requirements and regulations.

Competencies:

  • Demonstrated experience and success in marketing and business development.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to lead/mentor new and existing staff.
  • Demonstrated ability to apply a high standard of scientific rigour to all projects and deliverables.
  • Aptitude and experience in management and administration is essential, including financial and human resource management.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
  • Experience working in large, multi-disciplinary teams.

Required Education and Experience:

  • Minimum of ten years managing water resource components of resource-based projects.
  • Demonstrated experience developing business and managing growing teams.
  • Eligible or have a professional designation (e.g. PEng, PGeo, PAg, etc.).
  • A relevant educational background in environmental sciences or engineering, with prior formal training / coursework in hydrology, climatology, hydrogeology and/or water resource management.
  • Experience operating in a dynamic consulting environment that requires leadership, flexibility, and teamwork.
  • A sound working knowledge of Provincial and Federal environmental legislation and environmental impact assessment methods is considered an asset.

Hatfield is committed to employment equity and workplace diversity. We strive for equity, inclusiveness and diversity, irrespective of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression or disability.

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV describing your experience and salary expectations in confidence through the online form or email:

resumes@hatfieldgroup.catsone.com

(no phone calls please). Please indicate “Water Resources Manager - Vancouver” in your subject line. Due to the volume of applicants, only short-listed candidates will be notified but we will retain your resume for any future openings.

title: Geological Technician
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?

We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
Reporting to the Senior Geologist, the Geological Technician plays a key role in the safe and efficient collection of quality exploration data including core processing, geophysical surveying and line cutting. The position is based at Noront’s remote Esker Site.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES (including but not limited to):

  • Drill Support - Assist in drill trail and drill pad preparation, down hole orientation surveys, drill core processing, including core moving, Rock Quality Determination, cutting, box labelling, sampling, and shipment.
  • Geophysical Support - Assist with surveying of cut lines and loops using differential GPS and assist with cutting and chaining of grid lines where required.
  • Soil Sampling Support - Assist in the proper collection, marking and bagging of soil samples using hand augers, following the standard operating procedure for soil sampling.
  • Follow health and safety responsibilities, under all applicable government legislations and Noront policies and procedures.
  • Actively participate in and contribute to a Positive Safety Culture on the project including following all Noront and Outland Safe Work Practices and Procedures, wearing and maintaining PPE and participating in Safety Meetings and Training as required.
Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?     

  • Interest and/or experience in Geology/Mining.
  • Chain Saw Operator certificate is required. Emergency First Aid certificate required.
  • Working knowledge of/experience with snowmobiles and ATVs.
  • Minimum of 2-3 years working in the bush or a remote camp setting.
  • Previous line cutting and geophysical experience is an asset.
  • Working knowledge of drill core handling/storage/cutting, and sampling is an asset.
  • Ability to follow directions and remain adaptable to changing work plans.
  • Ability to work efficiently and productively both independently and as a member of a team.
  • Comfortable working outdoors in all weather conditions.
  • Physically fit and able to handle the following physical demands:
    • Lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs.
    • Walk on un-even terrain, including climbing and while carrying gear.
    • Stand, walk, squat, kneel or sit according to task for extended lengths of time.


Additional Information

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?   

  • All meals and accommodations provided while working at site. 
  • Geological Technicians work on a 2-weeks in/2-weeks off rotational schedule. You are expected to work weekdays, weekends, and general holidays during your 2-week shift. 
  • Wages are paid on an hourly basis on an Overtime Averaging Agreement. Specific pay details are discussed at the interview phase. 
  • Outland and Noront are both well-established companies with strong roots in northern Ontario. Outland and Noront prioritize the development of our northern workforces and provide opportunity for growth and advancement within our organizations.

Dexterra  Group is  an  equal  opportunity  employer  committed  to  diversity  and  inclusion.  We  are  pleased  to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Mineralogy Technician
description:
Company Description

We are SGS – The world’s leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 96,000 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.

Job Description

This position will conduct a wide variety of testing and analysis on base and precious metal ores, industrial minerals and materials.

This job description applies to Laboratory Technicians in the Canadian metallurgical operations, in the technical areas of Mineral Processing, Gold Processing, Hydrometallurgy, Geometallurgy, Environmental Testing, and Mineralogy.

  • Receive, inspect, sort and label client samples.
  • Sort, crush, pulverize, split, and screen samples.
  • Conduct routine testing.
  • Record test data and communicate results.   
  • Carry out routine equipment maintenance.
  • Calibrate and setup equipment prior to analysis.
  • Install and operate equipment and systems.
  • Maintain a clean working environment.
  • Follow all company Health, Safety and Environmental policies.
  • Follow all Quality system protocols and report any discrepancies to the Supervisor.
  • May be assigned special or ad hoc projects.
Qualifications

  • A minimum of a high school diploma (or equivalent) is required.
  • A post secondary education (degree and/or diploma) in a Science related program is a strong asset. 
  • Good hand/eye coordination when handling samples & various equipment.
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner.
  • Candidates must be proficient in using various types of computer software (Word, Excel. PowerPoint & Outlook).
  • Candidates must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.
  • Ability to work well with others & independently.
  • Proven time management skills and a strong attention to detail.


Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process.  Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Senior Geochemist
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is looking for a SeniorGeochemist ready to advance their career. Located in Oakville, Ontario, our center of excellence for mine waste geochemistry provides world-class consulting services throughout Canada and around the world.

 

Please note this role may have the option to work from other Wood office locations across Canada or even remotely.

 

Our team includes geochemists with backgrounds in geology, aqueous geochemistry and engineering. Working collaboratively with our senior geochemists and other professionals we provide a positive entrepreneurial environment in which to work on challenging projects and continue your professional growth.

Skills / Qualifications:
  • Graduate degree in an applicable field (e.g. geochemistry, geology, earth sciences)
  • 10+ yearsâ€™ experience, with at least 5+ yearsâ€™ experience in an environmental consulting firm or mining company
  • Eligible for Professional accreditation (P.Geo, P.Eng. etc.) an asset but not a requirement
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience regarding acid rock drainage/ metal leaching and mine waste geochemistry assessment
  • Demonstrated experience with geochemical sampling design, water and rock sample collection, and analytical methods for mine waste geochemistry analysis
  • Demonstrated abilities with geochemical and water quality modeling using industry-standard software packages (e.g., GoldSim, PhreeqC, CE-QUAL-W2, and Geochemistâ€™s Workbench)
  • Proven ability to work independently and manage projects and tasks successfully within a schedule and budget
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work in a multidisciplinary environment
  • Willingness to travel for field assignments (approximately 5-10% of time)
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Junior Environmental Geoscientist
description:
At Golder, we thrive on challenges.
Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder has a new opportunity for a Junior Environmental Geoscientist to join our Environmental Management team on a full time basis based in Vancouver focussing on the contaminated sites practice area.

An overview of your role will include:

  • General field and office assignments under supervision
  • Conducting a wide variety of geo-environmental and hydrogeological investigations including field investigations of soil, groundwater and soil vapour quality
  • Preparing and adhering to site-specific health and safety plans to mitigate or eliminate risks to oneself and other Golder staff, client's personnel and the public
  • Maintaining a safe and hazard free work environment in line with our health and safety culture
  • Participating in a team environment within and outside of the Environmental Management team
  • Data management: collecting and managing field data and comparing the results to site-specific regulatory guidelines and/or protocols and data QA/QC to support technical reports
  • Travelling when required to conduct project work
  • Maintaining a high standard of behaviour to uphold WSP Golder's reputation and demonstrating a commitment to our Core Values
  • Other duties as required
You will have a background in:
  • Undergraduate degree in geology, geoscience, environmental science or related field
  • Experience in problem solving with industry standard commercial computer software
  • Strong technical, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Strong people skills and an ability to work in a team environment
  • Detail oriented with a focus on quality of work
  • Flexible and adaptable, with the ability to operate in both field and office environments
  • Must be eligible to register as Geologist-in-Training with Engineers and Geoscientists BC or other professional body
  • Willingness to work out of town, and at remote sites, primarily in British Columbia and Yukon for two to three-week long assignments
  • Valid British Columbia driver's license

Your benefits at Golder will include:
  • Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
  • Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
  • Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching
  • Global projects and travel opportunities

One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 15 consecutive years

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder, now a member of WSP, is a leading, global consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of Golder (member of WSP). Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Golder (member of WSP) as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Golder Associates Ltd. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), and all other applicable legislation. Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities upon request.

To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.

title: Directeur technique - Hydrogéologie
description:
Please be advised this position is advertised in French, as it is a requirement for the below noted position that qualified applicants have strong verbal and written communication skills in French.

Directeur technique - Hydrogéologie

Joignez-vous à un chef de file mondial en services professionnels. Nous sommes engagés à résoudre les plus grands défis mondiaux dans les secteurs de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation.

Principales responsabilités :

  • Diriger et développer une équipe en hydrogéologie dans l’Est du Canada;
  • Réaliser des projets en hydrogéologie comportant des volets en modélisation numérique de l’écoulement de l’eau souterraine et du transport des contaminants;
  • Réaliser des projets en rabattement de nappe et en contrôle de l’eau lors de travaux de construction
  • Encadrer l’ensemble des travaux de terrain reliés à l’hydrogéologie (forages et aménagement de puits, relevés piézométriques, échantillonnage de l’eau souterraine, essais de perméabilité, essais de pompage, etc.);
  • Analyser, interpréter et synthétiser des données géologiques, hydrogéologiques et environnementales dans le but d’élaborer des modèles conceptuels;
  • Participer avec les membres d’équipes multidisciplinaires de différents groupes d’affaires lors de la planification et la réalisation des projets environnementaux, géotechniques, miniers et de transport (offre de service, réunion de démarrage, estimations, etc.);
  • Collaborer avec les autres équipes à travers les Amériques afin d’appuyer la résolution de défis techniques spécifiques ou pour le développement d’opportunités de grandes envergures;
  • Rédiger des offres de services, incluant l'évaluation budgétaire
  • Rédiger des rapports ou documents techniques et en assurer la qualité dans le respect des échéanciers et des budgets
  • Gérer la relation avec des clients

Formation et compétences :

Baccalauréat en géologie, génie de l’environnement, génie géologique ou génie civil ou autres spécialités environnementales intimement liées à l’hydrogéologie

  • Cumuler 10 ans d’expérience dans le domaine de l’hydrogéologie
  • Être membre de l’Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec ou de l’Ordre des géologues du Québec   
  • Détenir une maîtrise dans le domaine de l’hydrogéologie
  • Excellente maîtrise du français tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
  • Maîtrise de l'anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit
  • Maîtrise les logiciels d’interprétation d’essais hydrogéologiques tels que AQTESOLV et Aquifer Test
  • Maîtriser les logiciels d’écoulement d’eau souterraine et de modélisation tels que Surfer, Feflow et Modflow  
  • Avoir sa carte d’ASP Construction
  • Être une personne autonome, méthodique, responsable, débrouillarde et ponctuelle
  • Souci du détail. Capacité d’analyse et de synthèse
  • Disponible pour coordonner ou travailler sur des chantiers à l’extérieur de la région, à l’occasion
  • Expert certifié pour la LQE
  • Avoir une certaine connaissance des technologies de traitement in situ et être capable d’évaluer et d’interpréter les interactions entre ces technologies et les données géologiques et hydrogéologiques 

Pourquoi choisir GHD?

Notre culture consiste à toujours donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes. 
Nous sommes une famille de gens intelligents, innovateurs, créatifs et passionnés par la résolution de problèmes. Dans notre entreprise détenue par ses employés, tout nous tient davantage à cœur. Lancez-nous des défis et aidez-nous à trouver de nouvelles solutions pour assurer la durabilité de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation pour les générations à venir. 

Notre engagement envers vous

« Engagement » est un mot puissant qui définit notre façon de faire des affaires, de servir nos clients et de nous soucier du bien-être de chacun. Nous vous fournirons les outils dont vous avez besoin pour exceller et nous soulignerons vos réussites. Nous vous laisserons donner libre cours à votre curiosité pour permettre aux esprits brillants d’accomplir le meilleur travail possible. Nous investirons dans de nouvelles idées et éliminerons les obstacles autant que possible. Enfin, nous vous encouragerons à collaborer avec des milliers d’autres personnes diversifiées dans l’ensemble de notre entreprise mondiale.

Qui nous sommes

Nous sommes engagés à résoudre les plus grands défis mondiaux dans les secteurs de l’eau, de l’énergie et de l’urbanisation. GHD est une entreprise de services professionnels dotée d’une expertise de pointe en ingénierie, en construction et en architecture. Fondée en 1928, GHD appartient entièrement à ses employés. Nous sommes plus de 10 000 employés diversifiés et qualifiés, unis sous la bannière GHD dans plus de 200 bureaux et sur cinq continents : Amérique du Nord et Amérique du Sud, Asie, Australie et Europe, ainsi que dans la région du Pacifique. En livrant d’excellents résultats sociaux et économiques, nous visons à bâtir des relations durables avec nos partenaires et nos clients. 

En tant qu’organisation diversifiée et inclusive, nous encourageons les réalisations individuelles et reconnaissons la force d’un milieu de travail diversifié. GHD est un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Sur demande, GHD fournira des mesures d’adaptation raisonnables pour les candidats handicapés tout au long du processus de recrutement et de sélection.

title: Senior Geochemist
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is looking for a SeniorGeochemist ready to advance their career. Located in Oakville, Ontario, our center of excellence for mine waste geochemistry provides world-class consulting services throughout Canada and around the world.

 

Please note this role may have the option to work from other Wood office locations across Canada or even remotely.

 

Our team includes geochemists with backgrounds in geology, aqueous geochemistry and engineering. Working collaboratively with our senior geochemists and other professionals we provide a positive entrepreneurial environment in which to work on challenging projects and continue your professional growth.

Skills / Qualifications

  • Graduate degree in an applicable field (e.g. geochemistry, geology, earth sciences)
  • 10+ years’ experience, with at least 5+ years’ experience in an environmental consulting firm or mining company
  • Eligible for Professional accreditation (P.Geo, P.Eng. etc.) an asset but not a requirement
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience regarding acid rock drainage/ metal leaching and mine waste geochemistry assessment
  • Demonstrated experience with geochemical sampling design, water and rock sample collection, and analytical methods for mine waste geochemistry analysis
  • Demonstrated abilities with geochemical and water quality modeling using industry-standard software packages (e.g., GoldSim, PhreeqC, CE-QUAL-W2, and Geochemist’s Workbench)
  • Proven ability to work independently and manage projects and tasks successfully within a schedule and budget
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work in a multidisciplinary environment
  • Willingness to travel for field assignments (approximately 5-10% of time)

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Junior Geochemist
description:
At Golder, we thrive on challenges.

Golder ( Member of WSP) is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder has a new opportunity for a Geochemist for our Mine Environment group at one of our Vancouver office. The selected candidate will support geochemistry-related projects and proposal efforts with an emphasis on the mining industry. Projects typically involve permitting, baseline studies, operational support, and reclamation/remediation.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Providing support for geochemical projects, specifically in mining environments;
  • Conducting geochemical characterization studies (soil, mine wastes and ore), associated groundwater and surface water sampling and other environmental investigations;
  • Collection, management and analysis of geochemical data;
  • Water quality and geochemical modeling;
  • Report preparation;
  • Demonstrating a "Safety-First" focus; and,
  • Maintaining a high standard of behavior to uphold Golder's reputation and demonstrating a commitment to our Core Values.
The successful candidate will have the following skills, abilities, and qualifications:
  • Degree in Geology, Geochemistry, or related field. Ideally with a strong quantitative background.
  • 0 to 3 years applied work experience
  • Academic knowledge of geology, geochemistry, surface water and groundwater interactions, hydrology, water treatment and physical and chemical hydrogeology.
  • Strong understanding of geology and chemistry.
  • Familiarity with industry-standard geochemical software such as PHREEQC, Geochemist's Workbench, and GoldSim would be considered an asset;
  • Strong data manipulation abilities including experience with data management tools (i.e., Excel, EQuIS, Access, Python, R).
  • Strong relational skills within the team environment and with clients are essential.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Willingness to travel to domestic and international project locations.
  • The candidate must possess a valid driver's license.

The selected candidate will demonstrate a passion for geochemistry and geology, possess critical thinking and problem-solving skills and be committed to producing technically excellent work in a client-driven environment.

Preferred :

  • Graduate degree in geochemistry
  • Experience with geochemical modeling codes (PHREEQC, Geochemist's Workbench)
  • Proficiency in spoken and written English, proficiency in spoken and written French considered an asset.

Your benefits at Golder will include:
  • Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
  • Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
  • Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching
  • Global projects and travel opportunities

One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 15 consecutive years

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder (Member of WSP) is a leading consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Golder Associates Ltd. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), and all other applicable legislation. Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities upon request.

title: Senior Hydrogeologist / Environmental Engineer / Project Leader
description:
Why GHD? Being the best we can be is in our culture. We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come. Our commitment to you Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business. Who we are We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation. GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

GHD is one of the world’s leading professional services companies operating in the global markets of water, energy and resources, environment, property and buildings, and transportation.

Privately owned by our people, GHD provides engineering, environmental, land development, and construction services to private and public sector clients across five continents. Focused on creating lasting community benefit. Our connected global network of 10,000 people delivers projects with high standards of safety, quality, and ethics. Committed to sustainable development, GHD improves the physical, natural, and social environments of the many communities in which we operate

Private ownership means that together with our clients we control our own destiny. You now have the opportunity to share in this future as a key member of our leadership team. 

Due to continued growth, GHD is currently seeking a positive and energetic Senior Hydrogeologist/Environmental Engineer/Project Leader with experience developing/maintaining client relationships and managing complex interdisciplinary projects to support and grow our business in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), with a focus on the eastern GTA area. We are open to this individual being out of any of our GTA offices (i.e., Whitby, Markham, Peterborough, or Mississauga).  

This is an excellent opportunity to serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and to take on an active role in the growth of our business through business/client development, technical advisory, and staff development/mentorship. You will work with a dynamic group of geoscientists and engineers supporting a diverse range of projects in land development and contaminant site assessment.

We offer a professional working environment and culture and believe that work / life integration is essential to the success and happiness of our people. We also offer competitive salary packages based on qualifications, skills and experience, as well as the opportunity for direct ownership in a privately held, quality driven and client focused company.

As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Intermediate Hydrogeologist
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood has an exciting career opportunity in our Physical Hydrogeology Group for a Intermediate Hydrogeologist. This position is based in the Greater Toronto Area and will support our infrastructure, municipal and mining work. The position will report to one of the group’s Senior Hydrogeologists and will be based in our Burlington office.

 

The successful candidate will be working with a highly motivated team of professionals delivering quality services on technically challenging projects. You would become involved with primarily physical hydrogeological investigations to support multi-disciplinary projects in a variety of fields, including construction dewatering assessments and permitting, water supply, transportation, mining, oil and gas, and energy projects, among others across Ontario.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for collection of hydrogeological data under direction from Senior Staff, including: logging of soil borings and rock cores, oversight of groundwater monitoring well installations, collection of surface water and groundwater samples and levels, collect surface water flows, aquifer testing (slug tests and pumping tests) and drilling or test pitting supervision
  • Collect and evaluate field measurements and record data in clear and concise field notes
  • Office activities may include data tabulation and presentation of field sampling results, including report tables and appendices, support for work plan preparation, interpretation of analytical results, preparation of investigation reports and other project documents under the supervision of Senior Staff
  • Follow company safety standards, participate in safety training, prepare and implement site safety plans
  • Interact with client, contractor or subcontractor representatives on project sites
  • Work collaboratively with members of the Hydrogeology Group and team members from other internal business lines and offices, as well as external sub-contractors/consultants, and clients
  • Work with other disciplines within Wood including but not limited to environmental, geotechnical and water resources
  • Opportunities to collaborate with Wood teams across Ontario and sometimes across Canada and internationally

Skills / Qualifications

  • Undergraduate Degree (B.Sc.) in Geoscience or Civil/Environmental Engineering with a focus on Hydrogeology
    • Registered or eligible for registration as a GIT or EIT in Ontario considered as assst.
  • Consulting experience in hydrogeology or related discipline considered an asset.
  • Team-oriented, self-motivated and safety conscious
  • Ability to work independently in both field and office environments with strong attention to detail and organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Strong technical, verbal, and written communication skills (English) are required
  • Competency with MS Office suite of applications
  • Some technical report and/or document writing experience an asset
  • Some experience with ArcGIS considered an asset
  • Must be willing to travel (mostly within Southern Ontario, but with occasional remote northern or out of province projects)
  • Valid Class G Ontario Driver’s License and vehicle appropriate for carrying field equipment

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.
